Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: SilkiEngland
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel and had a really good time. In a frenetic city, this hotel is quiet and unassuming but very comfortable and bang in the middle of all the attractions. Our room was on the top floor overlooking the courtyard and the only noise that woke us was my alarm clock. It was so peaceful. As everyone says, the location literally could not be better. Seconds from Trevi fountain, a few minutes from Pantheon and Piazza Navona and maybe 15mins to Colosseum and Forum. We didn't use public transport or taxi once apart from the 175 bus from Termini Station to the hotel. We walked everywhere easily - even to the Vatican and Trastevere (which was lovely) and it was no problem at all. Beds really comfortable - bathroom well equipped although bath and shower not that spacious. Rooms spotless. Breakfasts wonderful - you could really fill yourself up to take you pretty much through the day. Lots of reasonable restaurants a couple of minutes walk away. Staff unobtrusive but helpful if you needed assistance. If I was being very picky I would say that the breakfast room could do with brightening up a bit as it was a bit drab but this is not a problem in any way. I always trawl through this site before booking hotels and while exploring Rome I came across many hotels that I had considered but was really glad I chose this one. It was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: wibblemonster-uk
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for sightseeing in Rome. Just around the corner from the Trevi fountain but not so close that you get disturbed by all the other tourists. Lovely rooms and helpful staff. Also just across the road from the major bus routes and an easy walk to the subway. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice size rooms, very clean”
Reviews.Author: BigMommaof4
Reviews.Content: While traveling with another couple, my husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel. Our rooms were adjoining, overlooking the street. Not a great view but only ideally suited for touring the city on foot. Bathroom included a bidet and a shower/bathtub (although very small). The king sized bed was very comfortable and room was large enough that we didn't feel crowded. The style was modern, furnishings were well kept and the room was very clean. We bought wine and snacks at a near by deli and enjoyed them up on the roof top terrace one evening. Would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: NLKWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We just spent five nights at the Hotel Delle Nazioni and were very pleased with our choice. By far, the best thing about this hotel is its location. Step out the front door, look right, and you can see the side of the Trevi Fountain, mere steps away. You can get to the Spanish Steps, and two metro stations in about 10 to 15 minutes, and another 5 minutes walk will put you at the Colosseum and fora. There also appears to be a lot of great shopping a few minutes away if that's your thing. We booked a junior suite and it was perfect for our needs. We had a small sitting room, separate bedroom, and large bathroom. The bathroom had both a tub with shower and a separate shower stall, which was a little on the small side but fine. There was a very generous vanity with double sinks, which was really great for two people getting ready to go out. There was lots of storage for clothing, as well as space to lay out stuff. The closet also had a programmable safe. I will echo other comments about the beds - the bed was definitely the hardest I have ever come across. I still have sore spots from the bed after two nights away from the hotel. I would still go back, but I might take something to make the sleeping a little more comfortable. The room was scrupulously clean when we arrived, and was kept so during our stay. Breakfast was in a large room in the lower level, and in addition to the usual continental offerings, you could get scrambled or hard-boiled eggs and bacon. The pear yogurt was wonderful, and the food was plentiful. Unlike some other reviewers, we found the hotel staff to be friendly, professional, and always willing to assist. I was very ill for part of the time we were in Rome, and the staff was really helpful when we needed some assistance. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, clean hotel in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: WittyCutie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is neighbor to one of my favorite attractions in Rome, the Trevi Fountain (Fontana di Trevi). I usually favor chains that I know (Marriott, Fairmont, Sofitel, Best Western, etc), but this time I went with this unknown brand and was not disappointed. (By the way, it seems that the "delle Nazioni" is also a chain, but mostly known in Italy). Added bonus: since the Trevi Fountain itself is within walking distance of the Spanish steps, that makes 2 for the price of 1. You can linger at the Trevi Fountain in early morning before the crowds, and finish your day sitting on the spanish steps after a late supper in a nearby "trattoria". Also, there's a taxi stop about 25 meters from the hotel (on Ave. Tritone) so finding a cab is never a hassle. Also Ave. Tritone is a very passing street served by many buses. So, if you're staying long enough and can figure out the bus system, it's worth taking buses. The rooms are small by US standards, but fairly big for Italian hotels, and huge if compared to French hotel rooms. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was enough for me (I'm always on a diet) as well as the girls (cereals and the likes), but it may seem lacking for some. They do have eggs, but that's about it in terms of "hot" items. The restaurant staff and the concierge were very friendly and helpful. But one lady at the front desk (the one with whom you settle your bill) seems like she couldn't wait to get rid of us. Eating: The hotel has one restaurant, but it's closed between 3h30-5h30pm. We arrived around 4pm, very hungry and tired, but had to go out to eat. Unfortunately, the restaurants near the Trevi Fountain don't seem to be that great: they don't have to be to attract traffic, (Same with St. Peter's square near the Basilica). By contrast, ALL the restaurants on Piazza Navona are top-notch. So, I suggest eating in places like Piazza Navona, where the restaurants actually constitute 50% of the place's attractions, and you can still listen to some quartet performing. The hotel doesn't offer much to families with young children. So, if you have small kids with you, I suggest you stay with the mainstream Marriott, where you'll have a pool for them. But if your intent is just to "roam through Rome" and take in everything that city offers, you will have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not helpful or friendly”
Reviews.Author: 730LovedItaly
Reviews.Content: This was the third hotel my husband and I stayed in on our recent 10 day trip throughout Italy. The staff was neither helpful nor friendly. When we came down for breakfast, no one greeted us with a friendly "Bonjourno" or even bothered to smile at us. Same with the housekeeping staff we would see in the hallway. On two separate occasions, I found the staff completely unhelpful. Upon check-in, the man behind the desk gave us a map. I asked him to help me locate our hotel on the map (which he did) and the Roman forum. He had no idea what the Roman forum was. Unbelievable. A second time I asked for help, I asked for a restaurant recommendation near the Pantheon. The man behind the desk told me the name of a restaurant, but when I could not find a menu listed on their website, I asked him for another recommendation in the same area. He didn't know of any other restaurant in that area, which was only about an 8 minute walk from the hotel. On another note, our bathroom was very small, and the towels were so thin you could see through them-I wouldn't send those towels with my kids to sleep away camp.

Reviews.Title: “You'll be happy you chose it!”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd_12
Reviews.Content: Great location about 100 yards from Trevi Fountain (just around the corner so you're not bothered by the teeming crowds). Really nice rooms. First room had a very small shower. Upgraded after two days to an awesome room on 3rd floor with double sinks, large shower, huge walk-in closet. Rooms very clean and staff very accommodating. Wi-fi works great, but only available in the lobby for 5 euro/hour. When we checked out on the 8th day, I realized they had comped me for all wi-fi use -- a nice touch. Breakfast has great, varied offerings - bacon/eggs, various meats/cheeses, awesome breads, fruit, yogurt and more. All kinds of trattoria and cafes around Trevi, but they're fairly costly. Wander down to Trastevere for a host of good restaurant choices that are about half the cost. Closest metro stops are Spanish steps or Barberini, but bus drives right by the door on Largo Chigi. Public transit -- trams, buses and metro - work awesome. Navigated the entire city on public transportation for dirt cheap. I had considered the Westin, the Intercontinental and others, but was extremely pleased I selected this hotel. I suspect you'll be happy you chose it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Leedsweekenders
Reviews.Content: We can recommend the Hotel delle Nazione in Rome. It is literally just round the corner from the Trevi Fountain. We stayed for a long, snowy weekend for the Six Nations, and were very pleased with both the service and facilities at the hotel. The staff were friendly and professional - we didn't recognise any of the probelms with attitude referred to in some earlier reviews. When we arrived we were upgraded - this may have been because we specially requested a room with a view into the internal courtyard (as recommnded by earlier reviews). The room was very spacious and spotless, albeit a little dark (only 3 side lamps - no overhead light). The bed was huge and really comfortable. I agree with earlier reviews that the shower is somewhat on the tiny side, but we soon got used to it! The breakfasts are great - eggs and bacon, and the usual enormous array of cereals, fruit, yoghurts, breads, cheeses, meats, etc, etc. One of the best features of the hotel is the location - very central, and close to some lovely little restaurants/ trattorias. Close by too to some of the main tourist attractions like the Pantheon and Piazza Navone (2 beers on the square - 16 euros - but almost worth it for the people watching!). Can recommend Cafe Lo Zozzone behind St Agnes church on Piazza Navona - walk down the little side street (Via de Cupis) and look out for it on your left - it's weeny but the best lunch we had in Rome. Best sight of the weekend (other than us winning the rugby) was the Geography room in the Vatican Museums - and climbing St. Peter's Basilica. Can't wait to go back - and woudl defintely stay at Hotel delle Nazione again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: david s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend and really enjoyed our stay. Great location, good clean reasonable sized rooms with comfortable beds. first class breakfast. It's not cheap but for a short stay the location is first class as you can walk to the majority of Romes sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and in a fantastic location - but watch the bar add on's.”
Reviews.Author: FiView
Reviews.Content: We returned last night from a fantastic long weekend in Rome. The hotel is four star and lives up to it's status. Our group of six all went for the superior rooms, which didn't disappoint. The showers are small however and we are all slight built! The location was great, with the Trevi Fountain just at the bottom of the street. The closest Metro station is well within walking distance, as are some great bars, restaurants and sights. Our one disappointment however, was when checking out we were issues with a 18 Euro bar bill. Whilst we did have a few drinks in the bar on the first night, my husband and I paid cash -therefore had no outstanding bill to pay and had not even given out our room number. When we explained this to reception, they said the bar was closed at that time and they were just told what to charge. Therefore, we had to pay up. This is nothing compared to the treatment others received in our group. They were issued with a 54 Euro drinks bill for the first night and 14 for the second. They also paid cash for most drinks and only charged two or three to their room on the first night. Yet did not even go to the hotel bar on the second night. When they challenged reception about this, they too received the same response - albeit were let off the 14 Euro bill with the comment, it may have been written down wrong or someone may have given your room number instead! Therefore, we collrctively left 72 Euros lighter, paying for drinks we didn't have. A sour taste left, after such a great weekend. We fear that all drinks were perhaps paid for in cash (God knows where it went) and then charged a second time to our rooms. Far from good, especially in a hotel of this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Useless Staff”
Reviews.Author: ClsEmz
Reviews.Content: As a woman traveling alone I was looking for a place that was centrally located in an area that was well populated all times of the day and night. This was the perfect place. It felt like I wasn't walking more than 10 minutes in any direction before I was at one major site or another. They have the most comfortable beds and best bathrooms I've ever seen at a European hotel and the little outdoor patio was a great place to unwind at the early evening before heading back out for the night. The only complaint I have is the front desk staff was not at all helpful. I wanted help getting to Tivoli without joining a tour group and they couldn't tell me anything they all kept telling me they didn't know. They wouldn't even tell me what restaurants in the area were good. This would bring down my number of "stars" if I wasn't someone who could figure things out on my own. So if you're looking for a place that is only 2 seconds from the Trevi Fountain and 15 minutes from the Forum and 10 minutes to the spanish steps with comfortable beds and nice rooms this is the place for you, just come prepared not to get any help from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_Bee
Reviews.Content: Terrific location and very nice room. The shower is tiny but hey, it's Europe, be happy with a bathroom in the room. Breakfast was lovely each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great rooms, only a few minor things...”
Reviews.Author: tkamin
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is a very good choice for staying in a central location in rome. we've booked this hotel after looking through dozens of others and with location being the most important aspect this hotel is excellent - literaly seconds from Trevi fountain - we found ourselves finishing each day and starting every morning with a small visit to the fountain... now down to business... Pros: - LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION - Excellent location right near Trevi fountain, easy walking distance to spanish steps, piazza venezia, pantheon and piazza navona. - excellent rooms - we booked a superiour room and a single room - both were adequatley sized and with a nice balcony (not much of a view even though on the top floor). rooms seem well maintained and recentley refurbished with LCD TV and a mini-bar. - price - at the price we booked this is one of the more reasonably priced hotels in that area. cons: (these seem a bit small or petty but sometimes it's the little things that you really need and make the difference between good and great...) - breakfast - although breakfast was quite good it was not the "feast" some revieweres claimed - only one hot dish, only couple of cheeses, only one type of bread etc. you won't go hungry but it's a bit basic... -rooms: bed - the bed was quite hard, not prevented us from sleeping but simply not comfortable... -rooms: coffee/tea facility - even though it's not included in the room description we wrongly assumed that there would be such facilities in the room. the lack of such basic facilities is not critical but again impacts the feel of a "great" room/hotel. bathroom: Shampoo was dreadful. now if I would have read this in a review i'd probably laugh but having only one kind of shampoo/soap which literally makes you feel less clean you start to get a little annoyed. we even considered going out and buying a new shampoo... internet service: again not something we picked up from the description when booking but there's no WIFI available in the rooms, only in the lobby for additional charge. in addition there's no internet station available at all - only at additional charge. this seems minor but it's really below standards as any decent hotel offers either free wifi or free internet station at the lobby. Service - service was mediocore - even though they booked tickets for us which helped a lot, service was usually without a smile and no help was offered when we asked for map, directions, recommendations etc. late check-out was priced at 100 euros which is also a bit too much (basically a night rate). All in all this is a very good hotel with only minor flaws which can be overcome or overlooked but if they'll be fixed it'll be a truly amazing place... Tips: The gallery Cafe across the street has excellent cappuchino and offers free wifi - great place to start/end your day. the store right next to trevi fountain has really good prices when compared to other places nearby - great place to buy drinks, snacks and light food at the start/end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience and great location”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I went to Roe over the Christmas holidays. This was our first experience and chose this hotel from numerous options our travel agent gave us. She had not stayed here and we chose it due to the hotel location, resturant and bar. Well, we could not have been any happier! On coming into the hotel we were greeted by Salvatore. What a wonderful gentleman and he was so helpful throughout our stay! We had arrived early and were awaiting our daughter's arrival. Our room was not ready but Gusseppi took our luggage and directed us to where we could change our clothes. We then went into the bar for coffee. Everyone was so nice and helpful. And the Trevi Fountain was only steps away from the hotel! After sightseeing, we came back to the Hotel and Salvatore not only gave us wonderful rooms but helped get reservations for both Christmas Eve and Christmas night. Our rooms were of medium size (actually quite large for Europe) and very comfortable. (The bed was more hard than in the states but still comfortable). Opening our windows and shutters we had a very busy street but loved it! It felt like Rome! Next door was a lovely little church wherewe heard church bells and singing on Christmas Eve. Breakfast was good and plenty. The only slight negative as it was the same everyday but still very good. There was pannetone on Christmas Day! Everyone was polite and extremely helpful. Salvatorre was my absolute favoirite and I loved him! He alays had such a sparkle! We would definitely stay here again! It was so close to so many sights and a short cab ride back when our feet were tied from walking! Thanks to the staff for helping to make our Chistmas such a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KMCINROE
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome over Thanksgiving break 2011. This hotel has a great location and the staff was very polite and gave good directions to local attractions . The rooms were clean and spacious . The breakfast is good..eggs,bacon, meats and cheese and awesome baked goods... We will stay there again if we go back to Rome....

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for Rome sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Myles11
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was recommended by friends and I can see why. Comfotartable rooms , courteous efficient staff and the ideal location for sightseeing trips.Most of the major tourist attractions are within walking distance. The Vatican City was only a €10 taxi fare away .If you are the type of person who likes to "potter about" on a city visit then this is your hotel. The nearby narrow streets hide many architectural & cultural gems. The Trevi Fountain is 60 meters from the front door & you can pop down to see it before you go back to your room after breakfast. Fantastic way to set the mood for the day. The buffet breakfast caters for most people's tastes and will set you up nicely for a day's sightseeing. Visiting Rome was a great experience and staying in this hotel helped added to it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is First Class...Staff is Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: GRT75
Reviews.Content: From our moment of arrival we were greeted warmly by a truly professional staff. You couldnt ask for a better first impression. It was my wife's first trip to Europe and that warm greeting was a most welcome introduction. In particular, staff member, Mr. Nobili, was very accommodating with our itinerary. More impressive was this was the kind of service we would come to expect consistently during our stay from every staff member. Whether it was, currency exchange, electrical adapters for computers, Rome tours, and even transportation, the staff went beyond the call to help us. The rooms were every large, high ceilings with shutter windows that would let you capture the highlights of the city or shut them out completely. Temperature was a constant comfortable. This hotel is in a perfect location for any and all tourist attractions you could schedule. The breakfast? Fantastic! I was expecting the typical continental breakfast but quite the contrary. Wide variety of breakfast fare that would please any Roman Emperor. If you're planning a trip to Rome, you can stop surfing. You're in a safe environment, staying in a first class hotel, surrounded by one the most professional staff I have ever encountered in travel. Gary & Connie Thieman

Reviews.Title: “Nicwe hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kelli K
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for sightseeing. Very close to the Trevi Fountain, not far from the Spanish Steps and about a 10 minute walk to the Pantheon. Breakfast was basic, not comparable to other hotels on our trip. Staff was accomodating and pleasant. Room was a nice surprise being larger than expected (comparing to my past trip to Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Danielle B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to Trevi fountain, but just around the corner so its not loud from the crowds. We had the window open in the evening and it was quiet. Every now & again we could hear the horses clip/cloping down the street. Otherwise there is almost no car traffic on the street. We had problems with our credit card and needed to call a 1-800 #, but was having problems doing it from our room. We went to the front desk to ask how to call a toll free number. He ended up letting us use his phone for free to dial out for about 15 minutes! They were also very helpful with our luggage when we arrived at 8 am. When we came back around lunch they had our room ready. Breakfast is also included with this hotel. They had a great buffett of eggs, ham, fruit, coffee, juice, toast and just about anything you could possibly want. We've been to Rome before, but we liked this hotel best.

Reviews.Title: “100 paces to the Trevi fountain”
Reviews.Author: Barca752
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel delle Nazioni for 4 nights between 12 to16 October 2011. Found the hotel to be both comfortable and functional although we didn't spend much time there. We were given room 304 which was on the frontage of the hotel (the air conditioning worked but wasn't brilliant). However, got a little noisy with both traffic and people going to the Trevi fountain during the late evening and early hours. Breakfast was included in the price, there was a good selection and I would suggest you make good use of this given the general cost of food in Rome. Leaving the front of the hotel we turned right and in about 100 steps you were at the heart of the Trevi fountain -great location for touring.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Barbara F
Reviews.Content: With this being our first trip to Italy, we didn't know what to expect with the hotels. We were greeted by a friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are not huge but, more than sufficent. The shower was a little small for my 6'4" husband but, the rest of the room was fine. The hotel was clean and well kept. The breakfast was very good. The location was good and with the help from the staff, we were able to find our way around Rome. Salvatore at the front desk stood out for his restaurant referrals and his kindness. We would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Close to all the Sights of Rome”
Reviews.Author: bogusted
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice, before and after our cruise, so we had a good sampling of rooms between the stays. As a group we needed 5 rooms and each of them had their pluses and minuses. Needless to say all were very nice and clean, the interesting point in all rooms was how the bathroom had been designed - all were different and the showers with just enough room for one average sized person. As you've heard in other reviews the inside rooms are quieter than the outside rooms as they face an internal courtyard. Our children had an internal room on the inside, which was on the first floor and they could simply open the window and 'hop' out into the courtyard. On both of our stays we faced the building next door but that wasn't a problem as I've lived in cities most of my life and the noise really isn't that bad. All rooms were comfortable and out of the 11 in our group - no complaints. As for location you're about 80-100 paces from the Trevi Fountain deoending on your size. You're also within easy walking distance to many other of the prime Rome attractions. If you don't mind using the buses one of the local terminals is about 2 minutes from the hotel and using them isn't a problem. We found the staff to be friendly and attentive and more than happy to assist, but I will agree that the night staff are better at doing this than the day staff. Their English is OK and one of us spoke fluent Italian, so we had no difficulties with directions and recommendations from the staff. As I said when I started, we stayed here twice and I would stay here again. It has a great location, good staff, clean rooms, and isn't overly expensive for the center of Rome. Ignore the noise and enjoy your stay, maybe have a night cap before bed. A city without noise isn't a city. As they say Rome is the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: NiceCheese
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a short break to Rome with my girlfriend. When I was looking for a hotel in Rome iI was concerned about all of the reviews which stated that hotel rooms in Rome were generally on the small side but then I reckoned that this was due to the city being quite old so don't expect modern! I found that the room we had at the Delle Nazione was perfectly ok and not that small. We had a slightly odd one that was in a corner on the second floor and as such had a longer private corridor into the room from the door and windows on two side. The room was gorgeous! Very nicely appointed and spotlessly clean. the bed was very comfy and at least a queen size. The bathroom was good with a large shower (room for two!) The rest of the hotel was immaculate and clean. Breakfast very good, plenty of variety, filling and healthy. Reports of the staff being officious I think are a little exaggerated. They are simply very professional and courteous; no trouble at all. The location was great, about 5 minutes walk from the Barberini metro and walking distance to most major attractions, and good value when compared against others in the same district. There is always a wonderment factor when booking a hotel for a trip with the girlfriend> Will it be nice etc. Have to say she was very happy with this choice and we would return here again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Tjockey
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel in two years. It has an excellent location close to the Trevi Fountain and near to many of the most popular spots in Rome. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfast is very good. The location is hard to beat. This is our primary reason for choosing this hotel. I would like to comment on the hotel staff. I found them to be courteous and helpful. They are definitely professionals. I think this can sometimes come off as being rude which they are not. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a moderately priced (by Rome standards) hotel that is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Read and decide”
Reviews.Author: Erubin
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from this hotel, is close to fontana di Trevi, Pantheon and all other tourist atractons in this area. I will try to give some details to help. The hotel is located in the busiest part of Roma. This is a very central region, full of people circulating, many shops, restaurant and many surrounding buildings. This hotel is right in the middle of this mess, for those who like to be in a neighborhood like that so I have to admit that the region is perfect. I personally prefer to open the window and have a nice view and not a concrete building, I prefer quiet place with less noise. I booked a junior suite in this hotel, more expensive than a standard room but this room is in the worst location. Every day at 07hs morning the garbage truck passes and the sound it makes it is terrific, besides de motorbikes.. So if you want silence, request rooms overlooking the interior of the building. Breakfast at the hotel is basic, nothing special. The external appearance of the hotel is awful, the interior is nice. I found the hotel attendants nothing charismatic, the staff that work at night are much more friendly. There are so many choices of hotels in Rome, I see no reason to choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service are great!”
Reviews.Author: Beach0310
Reviews.Content: Right down the street from the trevi fountain and close to the Spanish steps. All the major site seeing is within walking distance. You can either dress up at night or be casual.....you won't stick out. The hotel breakfast was very good...an assortment of foods. The staff at the front desk were helpful with dinner recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: homeinboca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 3 nights prior to embarking on a Mediterranean cruise. We had a wonderful stay, the room was ready early and was perfect, clean and quiet, even though you were steps from the crowds at Trevi Fountain. You could literally walk out the door and toss a coin into the fountain! It was a great base to explore Rome for a few days. I would return in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate. Very clean!”
Reviews.Author: DDJ50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three days. As others have stated, the location is excellent and most landmarks are within walking distance. We were checked in immediately, suitcases taken to our rooms. The air conditioning works perfectly and you can adjust the temperature easily. The windows opened in our room (3rd floor double and twin) and it was a quiet room on a non smoking floor. The double bed was comfortable and the bathroom with shower over was fine. It would have been even better if the room had tea/coffee making facilities, an armchair and the satelite TV catering for English speakers as well. It only had CNN news in English, all the other channels were mainly in Italian; it would have been nice to have at least one UK channel(not that we watched much TV but when resting between trips out, it's nice to watch a bit of TV, even just to catch up on the news. The breakfast was ok, and was plentiful. They had ridiculously tiny cups for tea and coffee, they should have larger cups/mugs available. The breakfast staff were pleasant and helpful. The reception staff were ok and gave you only the minimum amount of information leaving you having to ask numerous questions in order to feel fully informed. The cleaners/room maids were friendly and did an excellent job as the rooms were very clean. Overall our stay at the hotel was mostly comfortable with the an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: 3ksurout
Reviews.Content: Its hard to imagine a better value than this hotel. Its around the corner from Trevi Fountain, 5 minutes to the Spanish Steps, great shopping of all kinds and many good restaurants, and then 10-20 minutes from everything else you would want to see on your first trip to Rome (Colosseum, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Vatican, etc). The staff were great, the rooms were comfortable, cool and quiet, and the variety at the breakfast each morning was superb with as much cappuccino as you can handle. Anything rated higher has got to cost alot more money.

Reviews.Title: “Should be rated higher”
Reviews.Author: STEVE P
Reviews.Content: This was my 3ed trip to Roma and I have stayed in hotels on Via Vittorio Veneto, but the price of the rooms were way to high. A friend told me about this little hotel, what a location! We like to walk and you can walk to any of the highlights in 30 minutes or much less for most. One block from the Trevi Fountain, which is great fun day and night, not far from the Pantheon. Hotel was clean, we had an excellent room on the first floor. Room was quite with good A/C unit. Shower would be tight for a big person, but work fine for us. The beds were a little hard for me, but I did not go to Roma to stay in bed. Room was perfectly adequate for our four nights stay. Buffet had a good choice of hot or cold dishes, plenty of cereals, croissants, fruit, cold meats and cheeses. Good selection of teas and coffees and fruit juices. Rome was perfectly safe, as I said we walked everywhere and never felt uncomfortable day or night, police were everywhere. We were told to not look to flashy at the major attraction, because pickpockets will target you, but we had no issues. Trevi Fountain is amazing either during the day or night time, go to the last gelato on the left as you face the fountain, I did every night and a few days. By the way DO NOT USE ROME TRANSFERS for your car service. We had a flight delay getting into Roma which they did handle, but that was it. We were on a 7 day cruise, got off the ship, no van (4 of us). Called them and 20 minutes later a Benz wagon shows up. We had to luggage in our laps for the 1 hour ride into Roma. Booked them for a Vatican tour, driver was late as was the guide. Tour guide was good. Called the day before leaving to confirm our transfer @ 6:15 AM. We get out i n front of the hotel, they NO SHOWED. The night manager at the hotel was very apologetic offered us a BK to go bag and got us another car. DO NOT USE ROME TRANSFERS.

Reviews.Title: “Trevi fountain around the corner”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, walking distance to all your main sites. Although you are very close to the trevi fountain, you still have privacy and the room is quiet. AC is good, shower is tiny but worked well. The breakfast is just ok. If you plan on during a lot of touring during your stay in Rome, you can't beat the location. If you plan on spending a lot of time in the room, you might want to continue searching. The staff is okay, not overly friendly but efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the superior rooms were perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jacebishop
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff could not have been more helpful. They were friendly and always willing to provide assistance with directions. The rooms were very clean, good closet space and the location is a stones throw away from the trevi fountain. We would definitely stay here again if our travels bring us to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: Anniversarycouple86
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and well kept. Triple room accommodation was excellent. We liked being near the Trevi. Close to walk to most all of the main attractions. We did take the metro to the Vatican, but it was easy and inexpensive enough to do. Only thing that we did not like was the lack of any free internet service. Every other hotel we stayed at offered us a minimum of one hour free service, if not unlimited. At 5 euros an hour, it was costly to email. Also, we were unable to access the service from our room, so we needed to spend the hour in the lobby on the internet. Other than that, it was a fine hotel, and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: GVBJD
Reviews.Content: We are so pleased we chose this hotel. The location is perfect - just 50 metres from Trevi Fountain. The room is not opulent but is clean, modern and functional - everything you need really. Staff are helpful and friendly. Breakfast was fine. All in all great value for money and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for professionals”
Reviews.Author: joyce082
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and accommodations were good. The staff was helpful but very businesslike. Not a warm and cozy place.We had 2 rooms and they didn't put our rooms together or even on the same floor. It was one block from the Trevi Fountain which was to busy an area for our liking. Breakfast was good and they included some eggs and bacon which was a nice change from the typical European breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ladiesel
Reviews.Content: Fourth hotel we stayed at during our European Holiday this year. Hotel and rooms in general were great. Very nice, clean and comfortable. Location is also perfect, only a few steps away from the Trevi Fountain, but the immediate area was actually not as loud as I thought it would be. It is also within walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Wedding Cake, Pizza Navona, the Coliseum and Roman Forums. The Vatican was also just a short taxi ride away. We booked a junior suite and a double room because we were a party of five. I stayed in the suite and I have to say it was beautiful room, it had a good sized bathroom with complimentary slippers and bath robes. The suite was pretty big with high ceilings and wooden floors. Air conditioning was excellent. The only complaint I have about this hotel is that we were put in the wrong type room on our first night. We booked one junior suite and requested a courtyard view and ended up in a deluxe twin. I approached the front desk right away, but was told they were fully booked and we had to wait until the next morning to move to a suite with a courtyard view as I requested in advance. The next morning, they gave us a keycard for the room we were suppose to be moving to and we were glad we checked it out because they were giving us a suite, but it was right next to an alley and not the courtyard. After speaking to the manager, we were finally granted a junior suite with a courtyard view, but by this time, I was pretty upset already and so it seemed the front desk people were as well. This was a bit disappointing considering I had e-mailed the hotel way in advance to confirm our reservation and our special request to have a room with a courtyard view. The manager replied to my email and confirmed that my request would be taken cared of. I couldn't believe that despite doing this, they still made an error upon our arrival. Even after admitting to their mistake, the hotel didn't offer us any compensation or a proper apology at all. I would recommend this hotel because of it's general appearance, nice & comfortable rooms and it's location. However, I suggest that upon check-in, you re-iterate the room type you've booked and any special request to make sure you're put in the right room before it's too late.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the location, which is adjacent to Trevi Fountain...”
Reviews.Author: Sandradot
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, bathroom was pretty small and the breakfast was adequate though not comparable to the hotels we stayed in Florence & Venice. The location is great, literally around the corner from Trevi Fountain and walking distance to Pantheon, many Piazzas, Spanish Steps and the Coliseum. The lobby is modern with stunning lighting and the staff was very courteous. Smallest room of the three hotels we stayed at in Italy, though the priciest. Lots of restaurants and shopping surround the hotel. Hotel charges for wifi and you have to use it in the lobby which was kind of annoying. You do need to taxi to Vatican, and I'd get a price before every taxi ride because there were some very dishonest cab drivers, though most were honest. One cab quoted us 18 euro from the Coliseum (we were exhausted after a long day of site seeing) and when we thought that was high, we found another one who did it for 8 euros. We would highly recommend doing a Seqway Tour of Rome, it is incredibly fun and you cover so much more ground and learn so much from the guide.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sally003_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely well situated - within walking distance of nearly all of the major attractions. The Trevi Fountain is practically next door, the famous (and best in my opinion) Gelateria, Giolotti, is a 5 or so minute walk away. You can walk to the Pantheon in about 10 minutes and Piazza Navona in about 15 minutes. The metro stop, Barberini, is also nearby (5 or so minute walk) and there's a cab stand about 50 feet from the hotel entrance. The hotel was immaculately clean and the beds were firm but excellent. The room and bathroom size was typically European and small by American standards. Air conditioning worked well. Rome is a noisy city but the double wooden shutters kept the street noise to a minimum. The shutters coupled with the curtains made the room "cave like" for sleeping. The staff was pleasant and helpful but we didn't require much of them. The breakfast food assortment was quite plentiful - eggs, bacon/other meats, various breads, yogurt, fruit, cheeses, etc... I'd term the coffee and juice quality "adequate - since both were dispensed from a machine (e.g., not freshly made/squeezed). Rome is an expensive city (especially given the euro) so from a "value for money" perspective, this hotel wasn't a bargain. However, the F/X rate is part of any decision to travel to Europe now so it's not useful to comment about prices in general or the price of this hotel in dollars, in particular. Free wi fi would have been a nice touch but other than that, no other suggestions. There wasn't a gym at the hotel although there was a daily fee gym reasonably close by that the hotel staff suggested. Given the amount of walking we did on the Rome cobblestone streets and the ruins, a gym wasn't really required - unless someone was in training for something and needed a treadmill or other equipment. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A tired hotel that needs a upgrade fro top to ntoe - including the peopel at reception”
Reviews.Author: shloffer
Reviews.Content: Had two stays one at the end of June and the other late July - on a prepaid deal. By the end of the first stay we wished we hadn't prepaid. The hotel is clean and it is close to the Trevi Fountain, but that is about it. Rooms are sparse on lighting - it is difficult to see in the shower with the shower curtain closed and the bedroom relies on the window for light , unless you get THE room with the balcony which for us was the redeeming feature of the hotel. Not that the balcony was well fitted out - one sparse sun lounge and a basic table and 2 upright chairs, but it did make a dark room feel lighter. Upon our return, we were told that someone else now had that room and that we would be given a "superior room". Unfortunately ( for this hotel) we had just traveled all over Italy in 3 and 4 star hotels and even the most basic rooms that we stayed in were far superior to this one. We came here with high hopes and left with a bad taste in our mouths -despite the begrudging offer of a free drink at the bar and a supercilious offer of some free internet time. They say you pay for what you get - we paid a lot less elsewhere and got a lot more!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: LeftMyHeart94131
Reviews.Content: Hotel delle Nazioni hit the sweet spot for our family. It was clean, extremely central and convenient (When we got turned around in this big city with tiny streets we just asked to be directed to the Trevi Fountain!) and offered all the top notch "necessities" without the expensive 5 star "frills" a traveling family rarely needs. Our non-smoking triple room was spacious, quiet, and the bathroom was enormous. The staff initially seemed professional but cold, but once we started asking questions they were delightful, calling cabs, offering dinner suggestions, and providing directions and helpful hints about the area. They even patiently answered our questions about Italian politics! Hotel delle Nazioni's breakfast buffet was fresh, varied and generous, just what a family with hungry kids needs before a busy day walking miles in lovely Rome, especially given how expensive (in American dollars) meals around town can be. A week later following our cruise, we returned to Rome for one night and had booked a three star hotel a few blocks away to save money. If you can, pop for the additional cost of Hotel delle Nazioni. It was worth every penny by comparison. One last thing. If you wake early with jet lag, walk the few meters to the Trevi Fountain. It's even more magical when you're the only one around!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, excellent staff, cold a.c.”
Reviews.Author: CaptErnie
Reviews.Content: This is a well above average hotel, which is hard to find in Italy without paying an exorbitant 5star+ rate. The internet is extra, but at a reasonable rate since it can be logged off & on($28/24 hours). Room a.c. worked well which is also hard to find in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: SRRNorthamptonshire
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days exploring Rome from the Hotel delle Nazioni. Hotel is centrally located. Rooms are well presented and although not large we found we had adequate space and a comfortable surroundings given the relatively little time we spent at the hotel. Breakfast is relaxed - help yourself to the buffet. We ate at the restaurant on our first evening and found the food to be good, although perhaps a little more expensive than you will find when out and about. A good base.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice. RIght next to Trevi Fountain!”
Reviews.Author: SolLight
Reviews.Content: We were completely satisfied with this hotel. The location was awesome. If you walk out of the hotel front doors and turn right the Trevi Fountain is one block down on your left hand side. There are lots of gelatto and pizza options right around the hotel as well. The rooms were basic but clean and pretty modern. Breakfast was included in our rate. The breakfast was just ok. There is a restaurant/bar and computers available for use for a fee. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, great breakfast, super location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Haloblonde
Reviews.Content: A must stay hotel! Clean, close to major sites, easy to walk to restaurants, helpful staff and modern with a touch of classic Italy. Would stay again. Wifi downstairs and they charge for this service. Air conditioning needs to be upgraded because we were just uncomfortable showering and sleeping in the warm room. Nice place and will become one of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: KK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location very close to the Trevi Fountain. Upon check-in, we learned that there was no triple room available, which we reserved months before. Max, who was working the front desk, put us in a double room and a single room and kept our rate the same. It actually worked out better b/c we had more space that way. All of the employees who worked the front desk were very nice and helpful. FYI- they can do currency exchange too. We only got down to the breakfast buffet one morning. It was good. The rooms were nice but small (but that's Eurpoe for you). The beds were a little hard. My one complaint is that they should have at least 1 channel on the TV that broadcasts in English. All 30 or so channels were in Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: mlee9097
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a great find thanks to on-line reviews. Room was clean and modern. It was on the 5th floor (top) away from the street with a private balcony. Very quiet with heavy balcony doors and shutters. Hotel location was excellent and just steps away from Trevi Fountain. Guests can walk to major sights from this central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & location. Worth paying the little bit extra for!”
Reviews.Content: I went with my partner for a weekend city break, we wanted to explore the beauty of Rome including its fine cuisine & wonderfull sights. I picked the Hotel Delle Nazioni due to reading so many good reviews on here and also beacuse of its prime location. We were a minutes walk away from the beautifull Trevi Fountain & also from one of the main strips of Rome which led us easily to many of its top tourist hotspots. The Hotel staff were very friendly & helpfull. The hotel had excellent amenities & the continental breakfast was ideal to start the day off. The rooms were well equiped & were cleaned daily which was v.good, the air-con was worth its value in gold & we had no complaints at all, we were on the 5th (top) floor & had the added luxury of a balcony aswell at no extra expence. Well I say no complaints, except for not understanding the symbols on the taps in the bathroom, C stands for caldo which means hot in Italian & F stands for freddo which means cold in Italian so at first being a typical Brit abroad I thought we had no hot water untill & checked the other tap. Which could have being embarassing for myself if I had complained. To come to a conclusion I would recommend the Hotel Delle Nazioni without a doubt, its worth paying the little extra for if you are wanting a 4* hotel & many people tell horror tales of Rome being expensive but all I can say is shop around & look for the best value before commiting yourself. I found many good value restaurants hidden away & the Trastevere part of Rome is well worth the visit for a good value night out with excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location with very unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Greg605
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location by the Fontana di Trevi, the rooms were spacious and comfortable, sadly the staff was extremely unfriendly to the point that I'm not sure I would ever stay here again. The second day of my stay I departed at 7:00 am for an all day tour, the staff assured me with confidence that they would take care of us and would make special accommodations for my group of 10 to have breakfast. The breakfast area did not open before 7:00 and the "take with/ breakfast to go" the staff suggested they would provide never materialized, basically we manged a croissant on the run to the bus. Each time I dropped off or asked for my key I felt I was inconveniencing the staff. I was on a tour, the hotel was prepaid, at check out I was surprised to find that I owed for a never before mentioned city tax, it was the last day of the trip and I was out of euros, surprise surprise the hotel didn't accept credit cards. Try having the hotel clerk calculate the exchange rate between dollars and euros at 6:30am, not the best way to start off the day. If you don't care about the incredibly unfriendly staff this is a nice hotel in a very good location, I would say it's worth it. If it's important to you that the staff at least acknowledge your presence with a simple hello or thank you at some point during your stay, then I would suggest you skip this place and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “We warmly recommend Hotel delle Nazioni”
Reviews.Author: vmayer
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at Hotel delle Nazioni, Rome. The location is excellent; just a few steps from the Trevi Fountain which is mostly central. It is also a very safe area. Most of attractions and sights are within walking distance, the hotel is also close to bus stations if you would like to catch a bus. The room (superior room) was very pleasant, spotlessly clean, great bed and bathroom facilities. The room was at the back there for it was quiet. It was overlooking at a very pastoral internal courtyard and had a little balcony. We closed all the windows sealed and black out shades so the room was totally dark for a good night sleep. Breakfast was a nice self service Buffet. The staff were all very helpful and accommodating, Especially Massimo, Salvatore and the porters who were fun to talk to. There is a little supermarket near to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RebusGirl
Reviews.Content: If I was going back to Rome I would definitely stay in the same hotel. Standard rooms are a little small but overall it was a great experience. The location couldn't be better, just next to the Fontana di Trevi, you can find anything you like around. I was amazed by how friendly and helpful the staff was, always willing to assist with questions as well as to offer advice. Quick room service and highly efficient.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: fgsteno
Reviews.Content: As all of the reviewers have said, this hotel is at a great location. You really can walk to just about everything. We walked back from the Vatican one day. We also walked to the Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, and of course, Trevi Fountain. It is also very quiet at night. They have heavy shutters on the windows, and you don't hear a thing, or see any light, either. However, having said all that, the most disappointing thing was the breakfast. The use a coffee machine, kind of like one of those instant vending machine things. The coffee was undrinkable. They also have a vending machine like that for juice, which tasted like Tang. If coffee is important to you, this is a big consideration. I read that on some of the reviews and blew it off. Well, it could have been a deal breaker for me. I really need some coffee in the a.m., and if it's included in the price, I didn't feel as though I should have to go out to get coffee that was drinkable. Other than that, the hotel was very clean, and the room was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Opinion8ted
Reviews.Content: My family of three booked the delle Nazioni through an online travel agent as the third of three hotels in Italy. We loved the location -- a block from the Trevi Fountain, just off of the Via Tritone but tucked into a quite side street. We slept with the windows open every night (rooms opening to the courtyard are ideal) and heard birds, not traffic. Via Tritone has a taxi stand and bus stops within a block of the hotel for longer jaunts, though we were able to walk virtually everywhere on the east side of the Tiber. Our room for three was like a junior suite with the sofa made into a comfy bed, and pocket doors to separate that room from the room with the king bed. Our teenager loved this feature. Bathroom small but very clean and modern. King bed extremely hard, but sure beats a double bed. A large, walk in closet. The breakfast was average (coffee self-serve out of a machine, and not good) and the staff ranged from surly to extremely gracious, depending on which person you got. Be advised there is a new Rome hotel tax for four and five stars of 3 euro a night per person which must be paid in cash. Don't eat at the hotel restaurant; walk about three blocks east to the Tritone trattoria, which has terrific traditionally Roman food at good prices (though the wine by the bottle is relatively expensive -- get the very servicable house wine).

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as I was hoping for”
Reviews.Author: JBoothe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Trevi Fountain, but that is about all.... It is quite a walk to all other sights. We arrived in Rome via Train, took the Metro to Barbarrini stop and walked to hotel. In hindsight, a taxi would have been money well spent. Roads are cobblestone and difficult to navigate with luggage. Metro stops have mostly steps. Escalators were not working properly. For the hotel.... check in was easy, the room was sufficient. Not really any view- saw 1 other apartment or hotel building. Wi-fi is available but extremely expensive. We found a cafe- News Cafe- around the corner where we ended each afternoon with a glass of wine and skyped the kids. The hairdryer in the bathroom works, but not well. Very little air and it gets really hot in your hand while holding it. Hard to use. Breakfast was very nice. There is a supermarket across the street to pick up room snacks or drinks. Our favorite nearby restaurant was Vineria Il Chianti. We enjoyed dinner there twice. We forgot about the city room tax when we checked out. That must be paid in cash euros. We luckily had enough left for that and the taxi to the airport. Not a bad experience, but my least favorite of the three places we stayed in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and accommodation with a few set backs”
Reviews.Author: Buff_and_Drew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location and I really enjoyed being close to the Trevi Fountain. It was easy to walk to all important landmarks - we even stolled to St Peter's Square one evening (absolutely stunning at night) after dinner and it didn't feel like too much of a walk. The room was clean and decorated to a high standard. The breakfast was good and the serving staff were polite. San Crispino ice cream and Il Chianti restaurant around the corner were a great tip off given to us by an Italian on the plane journey. However, the biggest let down had to be the staff at the front desk. There was one guy who was really helpful but the others were rude and came across as very impatient with us which was a shame. We asked them to book us a taxi to the airport, which they arranged, but they were quite abrupt and seemed sulky because we wanted a taxi and not one of their "cars". Overall, a good base to start in Rome and we enjoyed our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robsmodern
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend in January. (Unseasonably good weather but no crowds, so no complaints here!) This hotel is excellently located, just a few paces from the Trevi fountain and easy walking distance from the Spanish Steps, shopping, the Keats/Shelley house, and the old walkable part of town. Maybe the walk could be a bit far from the metro if you don't know where you're going and have lots of luggage. The room itself was a bit on the small side, though that's par for the course in Rome. Can't say that it was good value either. And front desk staff were either very friendly or very unfriendly ... maybe someone was just having an off day. One fixable complaint is that there's a lot of hallway noise in the rooms, mostly thanks to inconsiderate guests who bang about in the morning while taking their suitcases to the elevator. C'mon people, just because it's your last day of vacation, it's not everyone else's!

Reviews.Title: “should not be 4 star”
Reviews.Author: knd501
Reviews.Content: rooms were adequate but not 4 star. biggest problem was front office staff. our pre ordered taxi did not arrive for 2.15pm pickup. we phoned hotel who said it was on its way,waited until 3.00 then found our own taxi - hotel said they would charge us but finally backed down after some discussion!!! on returning home found message saying taxi would be there in 5 min ? I agree with many of the other complaints e g tv/computer room/general helpfulness but would say room always clean.Totally disagree with complainant who said food at Quirinos was adequate-it was diabolical-we had the one course and left Try the Grill & Wine restaurant - fabulous food and musician to boot for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Indifferent Service at Best”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkercynic
Reviews.Content: Literally down the block from the Trevi Fountain, this is a good location (if you don't mind crowds at all hours), but the staff here tend to be surly and give the impression that they would be happier if American tourists stayed elsewhere, and seemed put-upon when asked for walking or public transportaion directions. Rooms are smallish with a somewhat 1950's feel. The staff will only give one key per room, and because the key must be in the slot by the door for the lights in the room to work, one person cannot leave the room while the other is in the shower if they want to be able to get back in the room. Hallways are noisy, making sleep sometimes difficult. Breakfast buffet offered a reasonable selection, but it is served in s rather cramped back room that is not terribly attractive. This is a moderately priced hotel that could be a lot more appealing if the staff had a more customer-focused approach.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service from rude staff”
Reviews.Author: willandlauren
Reviews.Content: Possibly the worst hotel experience that we have ever had. The staff at this hotel were rude to say the least. Unhelpful and even when queried regarding hotel services they were more interested in continuing their conversation with other staff than answering your question. After four attempts to get an answer as to whether english television channels were available, we were met with a curt response that the satellite was not working. If I were to ever advise someone of where to stay in Rome it would most definitely not be here. Compared to other European hotels this place does not reach the mark for service. Reliance on location alone does not substitute for service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel! Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: mollyrobo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. less than one minute walk to the Trevi fountain. Hotel located between Trevi fountain and Spanish steps, we walked everywhere. We stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel to be very comfortable. Suprisingly quiet due to the shutters on the inside and outside of the windows-great for Rome! Room was decent size & clean, great shower. Breakfast was a good selection of the usual - bacon, eggs, cereal, fruit, yogurts,bread, juice. Great service from all the staff. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small cramped room”
Reviews.Author: MJVOLKER
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very convenient location but the hotel was very old and could do with a bit of restoration. The bedroom they put us in was very cramped it had 2 single beds pushed togeather to make a double bed and with that in the room you hardly had any room to put a suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “No service hotel”
Reviews.Author: friza999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and agree with those reviews that state that the hotel's location (near the Trevi fountain and Pantheon and other walkable tourist sites) is convenient. The room was adequate and quiet but only had Italian tv channels (most 4 star hotels provide an international mix of channels). But the delle Nazioni loses major points with its complete lack of service by the front desk. They sent us to a truly miserable touristy restaurant called the Quirino which had the ambiance of a morgue. The food was average. The desk seemed only to recommend the same two places to eat to every guest that asked -- Alfredo was one of them. Most of all, when asked about specific restaurants, like Trattoria Monti, we were told, "Oh, it's too far away" or were told they didn't know the restaurant in question. All in all the front desk was very unhelpful and somewhat unpleasant. Other things to note -- there was no in room wifi and the business center consisted of an old computer in a room slightly bigger than a closet. The cost of use of the computer internet was five euros for an hour. I think that a four star hotel should have in room wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: turbomkt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few seconds away from Trevi Fountain and not much more than 2km from any of the sights we wanted to visit in Rome. We walked past the Coloseum one morning and walked back from the Vatican. The room was excellent. We splurged and got the king size bed, and were not disappointed. About the only thing it didn't have was a view, but convenience to all the different locations was what we really wanted. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nmprincess06
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of November and had a wonderful stay. We arrived around 1pm and were able to check straight into our room. The room was lovely, very spacious and clean, well stocked mini-bar and a lovely bathroom with toiletries, our room overlooked the front of the hotel, which I thought may be noisy in the evening, but we heard nothing! The breakfast was great, with pastries, cereal, yoghurts, fresh meats, cheese, and also bacon and egg. It was a lovely a way to start the day. The hotel is located within 100m of the Trevi Fountain which was fantastic. We found this hotel to be perfectly located for us, we walked to all the sites, Colosseum, Vatican, Spanish Steps, Piazza del Popolo, Trastevere and loads more. We used the hotels car to take us back to the airport, and they charge 50Euros. They were able to keep our bags until our flight, so we could enjoy our last few hours strolling round the city. Overall we had a fantastic time and when we return to Rome we will certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jas151
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally steps from the Trevi Fountain, so it was a great location. The staff was friendly, breakfast offered a good variety of good food, and our room was clean and modern. We enjoyed our stay and absolutely loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Glasgweigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month for 4 nights with my sister. Great room, towels and bedding changed daily. Breakfast very good with choice of hot and cold food, staff friendly and helpful and stored our luggage after check-out as our flight wasn't until the evening. Great meal in the hotel restaurant at a discounted rate. Fantastic location for walking to other sights, nothing really more than 20-25 minutes walk. Metro 10 minute walking if you need it. Would recommend hotel to others. Hope to go back to Rome one day and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay as a single person”
Reviews.Author: anntex1
Reviews.Content: This was really such a lovely hotel. I recommend it to anyone. I was single, and when I discovered it was so close to the Trevi Fountain, a few blocks from the Spanish steps, two blocks from the Emperor Trajan's monument. , I was really pleased. Their are lovely shops along the streets and a nice "mall" two blocks away. The staff was very helpful, even working on my curling iron to get it to work with their system. They arranged transportation to help me get to the docks to reach my cruise ship when my prearranged travel plans fell through. This is a European hotel, not a Hyatt, so stay here if you want a Roman feeling. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, safe,well mannered staff”
Reviews.Author: sdesign
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location. We walked everywhere. Beds were comfortable,breakfast was good and plentiful. Only wish they had free wifi. Price was 5 euros for 1 hour but for the price you pay for hotel it should be free. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but rather dull hotel”
Reviews.Author: julesy6
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 of us stayed at this hotel in mid Oct 2010 for 4 nights. We could not fault the location albeit a very busy, noisy area which is understandable considering it was in the heart of the city. The rooms were adequate - could almost swing a cat in them, the bed and the pillows were hard. Breakfast was quite good but the coffee in their machine was disgusting. We ended up getting our coffee from the American bar instead which was much nicer. The staff were courteous and helpful and the cleanliness of the hotel was good. I would stay here again because I loved where it was situated which was about 100m from the Trevi fountain which was crowded most of the day. We took photos very early in the morning before the crowds arrived!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LisainRoma
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have just spent the most amazing 4 days in Rome. It would be hard to find a better location or hotel. We occupied room 218 and were delighted to have, I believe, the only terrace attached to a room leading out of our room! The house keeping was faultless, every day the staff put clean bed linen on and all towels, toiletries changed. The room also contains a safe and good tv. It would have been nice to have had tea/coffee facilities provided but my sister had brought a little kettle etc so we always had our essential wake up cuppa! The bathroom had a lovely big shower with endless hot water, super! Breakfast is continental and has abundant quantity and variety to suit all tastes.We took advantage of the restaurant offer to guests of 20 euros for 3 courses per person and had the most delicious dinner with superb service. In fact ,all staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. Fantasic location, out the door, turn right, there's the Trevi fountain! We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful, noisy but well located and clean”
Reviews.Author: rsea1978
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on Trip Advisor feedback and overall we were happy, but only by Italian standards. The location is fantastic, the breakfasts are very good, the rooms are very clean. If you're looking for assistance with anything from the front desk you'll have to push and push to get assistance as they're unhelpful and borderline rude. The room we had was on a thoroughfare and despite triple shutters and a 5th level location, it was quite noisy. Their may be better out there.... but at a pinch I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rather gloomy hotel in very good location.”
Reviews.Author: newman_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the hotel in early October. Miserable reception staff - no reaction when we apologised for arriving late because of delays,, just an indifferent shrug. Our room was quite spacious but rather basic and pillows were rock hard. We only had a shower - a bath would have been nice- but we did have a very nice balcony which was the saving grace. It was also, to be fair, very quiet. Breakfast was a gloomy affair. No atmosphere whatsoever in so-called restaurant which was freezing cold with fierce air.con. which did not help horrible flu-like symptoms I had developed. Food was so-so, not really 4 star standard - scrambled eggs tasteless and coffee not wonderful. Can't deny brilliant location of hotel which did compensate in some ways but I will not be hurrying back to Rome and certainly not that hotel. At end of stay unpleasant woman receptionist nearly bit my head off when I asked if I could get to my suitcase which had been put in the holding room!.

Reviews.Title: “Delle Nazioni”
Reviews.Author: Oldtimerd
Reviews.Content: we had an excellent stay at this Hotel. would recommend it highly. Very centrally located, clean room, good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel just around the corner from Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: jland0001
Reviews.Content: We booked this four star because of the location. It was a great buy (for Rome) -- centrally located, nice lobby, good rooms with comfortable bath and good staff. We definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location”
Reviews.Author: ags9697
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel an excellent because of it's location. You are so close to Trevi Fountain and fabulous shopping on Via Del Corso. All of the attractions - Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, etc, etc are all just an easy walk from the hotel. Even the Colosseum and the Roman Forum are a nice walk from the hotel. The staff is not overly friendly, but courteous and helpful when approached. The room and bathroom are typical European as well as the breakfast. The croissants with Nutella were pretty awesome though! If I was going to Rome again I would definitely stay here again. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a very nice, centrally located place - this is it!”
Reviews.Author: Tamrn39
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews and looked at a lot of the advantages and disadvantages of the centrally located Rome Hotels. I am so glad we picked this hotel. First of all, management is very responsive. I immediately noticed Trip Advisor reviews were consistently addressed by the manager. When I made my decision and booked with delle Nazioni I emailed for confirmation and received a response within just a few hours! We arrived quite a few hours before check in, however they were able to safely store our belongings and we headed the few steps over to the Trevi Fountain. If the Fountain were just a bit closer you would be able to hear it from the Hotel. It is VERY close by. With it's central location and proximity to the fountain I was expecting a bit more noise. The windows had 3 sets of wooden shutters and room darkening curtains. Once the shutters were closed a majority of the outside noise was blocked. Our room had two single beds (I was traveling with my mother) - but was quite large and comfortable enough for a 9 night stay. We had a large walk in closet with a coded safe and plenty of drawer space. The bathroom was huge! Full size tube with shower curtain and hand held shower sprayer. Water temperature was consistent and pressure was great! We even had a double vanity which really cut down on the time it takes two women to get ready in the morning! The room was kept spotless by housekeeping staff! The front desk staff was very friendly and responsive to needs and although I tried to learn a few phrases of Italian, I was fortunate they all spoke English! The breakfast buffet was well stocked; meats, cheeses, cereal, rolls, croissants (yummy), eggs and bacon. You can definitely fill up and save money by skipping lunch. The buffet was available until 10:30, so there was mad rush and always available seats. I LOVED this place! Oh, I almost forgot, we had a bottle of chilled champagne in our room when we arrived! I will definitely be recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An ideal Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: MLBorish
Reviews.Content: Certainly not the cheapest but a great location, very satisfactory rooms, fine breakfast, useful assistance from the staff. All in all, it would be hard to beat at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, very nice room”
Reviews.Author: kellycccc
Reviews.Content: This room is steps from the Trivi Fountain, restaurants, shopping, and all major sites. We walked from there to every major site such as the Pantheon, Colesseum, Forum, Vatican, Spanish Steps and many other place. It was the ideal location. Breakfast was fabulous (lots of warm stuff) and the staff was good. Our first room was noisey from road traffic but they switched us to another room that was much better. We highly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “All about location- can't get any better!”
Reviews.Author: 7wonders88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights at beginning of September. After an early flight and a taxi ride of 40minutes we couldn't wait for our room. When we got there, we actually arrived earlier than check in. The gentleman on reception was very welcoming, informed us that there was locker storage to hold our bags, but after checking with housekeeping found our room to be ready. We stayed on the 4th floor- the hotel had lifts, which is rare in some Italian hotels, and were of able size for guests and their luggage. Our room itself, was lovely, over looked a court yard, so kept to noise of the road to a minimum, comfortable beds, large wardrobe, and TV we also had air con, - not really necessary for our room as the sun didn’t hit our room directly, but it was nice to keep it cool. The bathroom was spacious, but the shower was small. I'm a size 10/12 and knocked my arms on the walls several time whilst trying to wash my hair. Toiletries were provided. Our room was cleaned every day with fresh towels We would get up at about 7am (an early start is a must in Rome if you wish to miss the crowds of tourists at some sites) for breakfast. A selection of cereals, bread, spreads, fruits, cheese and ham, were available along with eggs and bacon, tea, coffee and juice. It a help yourself service so take what you wish, there are young girls waiting you if you need any assistance. The reception staffs were helpful, we needed direction one day and they gladly showed us the way on a map. Now the location! My gosh you couldn't ask for a better located hotel. It is literally 60sec walk to the Trevi Fountain. Turn left out of the hotel up Via poli 5min walk and you’re at the Spanish steps. 15 min walk to the Colosseum and about 30/40min to the Vatican. We caught the Metro at Bernini (10min walk) to the Vatican, as we knew that day was going to be a lot of walking, but then walked back. After 3hours + round the Vatican then on to the Castle, then walking back to the hotel was hard going. So you may want to re think walking. Piazza Nova and the Pantheon again 5walk down Via Del Corso- then there are signs telling you the way. All around the hotel are shops, market stalls, cafes, and restaurants. You really couldn’t find a better situated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Request an Interior room”
Reviews.Author: Scooter418
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delle Nazioni Hotel in Rome for our first visit to Rom. When booking I reserved a Junior Suite. Afer checking in we went to find our suite. The room was way overfurnished and did not allow much room to move around. TheTV in the sitting area of the suite was also missing. The sleep area was really small. We were also placed on a corner room near the street. We did not get much sleep this first night as the noise was unbearble with the mopeds zipping by all night. Then at 0500, the construction crew began on the building across the street (not really the Hotels fault) Sleeping was then impossible. However, upon request to more to a quiter room, we were given a interior Supreme room. This room was actually larger than the Junior Suite and was very quite.
