The bed was quite hard but I understand this is standard for Europe. The Desk staff was very friendly and the manager also adjusted our room rates accordingly. The best feature of thi Hotel is it's location to the sites. We actually walked to every venue except the Vatican City, although I think we cold have. The Trevi fountain was literally two blocks away. Visit this early in the morning a it gets crowded in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MRPaulRossi
Reviews.Content: Great location, front desk personnel could have been more pleasant/helpful, one woman in particular did not smile even once in four days.....if work is that bad, she should quit.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location adjacent to the Trevi...”
Reviews.Author: Anon7161977
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location adjacent to the Trevi fountain. Crowd and street noise in the room never seemed to be an issue. Most of the major tourism sites were within a reasonable walk or short taxi ride. The room wasn't overly large but didn't feel cramped and the bathroom was nice. The front desk personnel were over friendly and helpful though a few of the late evening individuals seemed a bit surly. The included breakfast was sufficient but certainly nothing special. Overall, the location is unbeatable but you will pay a bit more because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel: Clean, good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: occasionaltraveler91
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after reading so many reviews on Rome hotels. Deciding is hard because there are so many hotels in Rome and so many reviews. We were very happy with our choice. I had some concerns about reservation, service, etc. after reading so many reviews about so many hotels. This hotel has very good reviews. The price is of course quite high but well worth it. We booked the hotel through Expedia and had no issues getting our room. This hotel is very centrally located and for a short trip, it is essential to be in a central location, one minute walk to Trevi fountain, quiet location for sleep, close to Spanish steps, Via Del Corso for shopping, and close to all other major attractions. Staff was attentive, friendly, and polite. We wanted a late checkout and despite being so busy, they accommodated it. They charged 100 Euros for it but we expected that. They arranged for an airport transfer back from Rome for 50 Euros (in a Mercedes car) which is a very good price. The bellman made sure to get our suitcases from and to hotel. The hotel is very clean and neat. Our room was clean and had no issues at all. Nice marble bathroom (although I am not a big fan of the shower door which covered half of the bathtub not all of it and water would splash a bit but nothing major). The room was cleaned very well every day. They would put new shampoo and soap every day whether you use the old one or not (nowadays north American hotels don't put an extra shampoo if you don't use the previous one). The furniture was very nice and with a good design and good wood, all nicely stained as new. The bed was comfortable. There was a mini bar, TV, and nice large closet in the room. Most importantly there is a personal safe in the closet for your valuables. Internet is not free. 5 Euro for 1 hour of use. Wired internet in room and wireless in the lobby (So take your Ethernet cable). The area is quite despite being close to Trevi Fountain. It is just far enough to not hear anything of the noise of the water or the tourists. (You can't help if people in or around the hotel are noisy sometimes, can happen anywhere.) There is a grocery store just down the street towards Trevi (it looks small) where you can buy cheap bottled water (70c Euro each bottle), I think it is called Express. There is a currency exchange store just down the street towards Trevi, and there is also a bank right in front with a Cash machine. There is a Taxi stand right at the intersection which makes it very convenient to go anywhere and back. The hotel has a restaurant connected to it and part of it which is not bad either. There is a short walk to any of the attractions or shopping in various directions. For Vatican and Collessium I recommend a Taxi. The hotel has a breakfast room that serves breakfast from 7:30 to 10:00AM daily. The buffet breakfast is very good and includes eggs, cold cut meats, cheeses, butter, jam, fruit, milk, tea, various types of coffee, various breads, oatmeal and cereal, and honey (that's what I remember anyway). All in all, everything was nice and pleasant. We had a great stay. The price is not low but comparing it with other hotels in Rome and their options, it is an excellent value. I think it is the best value for the money of an average budget. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not if you want to sleep in past 5:00 a.m.”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa1421
Reviews.Content: Ok, I’m not a complainer and I do consider myself well travelled but I did have some issues with this hotel. First you arrive and the person at the front desk hands you a document and tells you to sign it. There is no information to speak of on the document but he tells you that you have to sign and that he’ll fill out the information later. Now I’m not a lawyer but my “spidey” senses were tingling. I wouldn’t sign it nor do I know of anyone who would sign it unless you’re tired and just arrived from a long trip and just want to head to the room. Anyway we had a junior suite and the girls had a double room. Both rooms were absolutely beautiful and we immediately unpacked for the last 3 days of our 2 week stay in Europe. After walking around for a while, we headed back to bed but were woken up at around 5:00 a.m. by the sounds of the deliveries (we were in room 215) and men talking just below the window. After some time the noise subsided and just before I fell asleep again, the recycled bottles were picked up. I’m sure by now you can appreciate how noisy it was even though both sets of shutters and the windows were closed. Before breakfast I asked for another room so that I could at least sleep in the next day. Breakfast was very good with an excellent selection. Everything is self-serve so the service was excellent (lol). Anticipating that they would give us a room in a more quite area, we vacated the room of all our belongings but when we returned at 7:00 pm, nothing was done. We called the front desk and were told that we were unreasonable to request another room at 7:00 in the evening since there were no maids to make up the room (by now I was getting really irritated). They did manage to get us a replacement room for the 3rd night but because we had to leave at 4:00 a.m. it didn’t make sense to change after all, I would for once, sleep in without hearing the constant noise (noise starts at 5:00 a.m.). Getting a taxi to the airport was quite frustrating. Fixed fee is 50 Euros but the front desk said that because you leave at 4:00 in the morning, it’s going to cost 65 Euros. Then Marco (the desk clerk) said that we needed a mini van since we were 4 people and had a combined 4 pieces of luggage between us. The price was now 75 Euros and we said sure why not but, when we returned the evening before our departure and requested confirmation that the taxi was indeed reserved for 4:00 a.m., we were told that the cost was now 100 Euros. Ever feel like you’re spinning in a vortex? At any time we might have been informed that should the moons and the stars not be properly aligned it might cost us more. Anyway, after some back and forth, we reserved a Mercedes taxi for 75 Euros and there was more than enough room for all of us and the luggage. Pros: Great location, beautiful rooms, decent breakfast Cons: Don’t take a room located on the side of hotel, no follow up from hotel staff, conflicting information from various hotel staff. Would I go there again? Not if I had to stay in the same wing.

Reviews.Title: “So-so, location works i would keep looking for a better hotel...”
Reviews.Author: travels120000
Reviews.Content: Room was small but clean. Location was close and quiet. No frills. We booked on miles but if I had payed 250-300 euros a night like they advertise I would have been hugely disappointed. Nothing like a concierge's or someone offering to call a taxi when you leave. Maid forgot to put towels in the bathroom which was annoying but they solved it within 20 minutes - good timing for Italy. It is not that I would say don't stay here but I think you can find better and I would not recommend it. Its fine, nothing more or less.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: I'll be brief: Pros: Overall this was a good choice for a stay in Rome in August. Location is unbeatable. We had a junior suite and our boys were in a superior double. Room size was acceptable. Rooms were in excellent condition and kept very clean. A/C worked great, even in 90+ degree weatther. Street noise was not a problem. Front desk was helpful. Cons: Hotel lacks a concierge service to help in planning tours and activities. Beds were as hard as a rock (common in Rome from what i understand)

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: sdemetropoulos
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location for walking to all the major sites in Rome. It's located near the Trevi Fountain with plenty of resturants around as well. Rooms are nice, comfortable and modern. The desk staff could be friendlier but they were not rude and were helpful when asked. This was a good value but location is their best quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in one of the best cities in the world.”
Reviews.Author: SMAMG
Reviews.Content: When you go to amazing cities, location is the key. In Rome Hotel Delle Nazioni's location is hard to beat, not only is it a 2 minute walk from Fontana Di Trevi, it is walking distance to all major attractions. Wake up early and walk to the attractions as you appreciate the city more. I recommend you pay that little extra for the hotel as you save in taxi fares and you can stop in and refresh at your hotel at anytime. The guys at the desk were most helpful when asked any questions. Breakfast was excellent for European standard.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: UpandAbout
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, clean, upscale hotel within a two minute walk from the Fontana di Trevi and just a few minutes away from all of the other major sights, restaurants etc. The front desk staff is a bit curt at times and not very friendly but will sometimes manage to wrench out a smile and a "Buon Giorno". A very "help as-needed, only when needed" approach is taken by the front desk. Which thankfully, was fine as we managed to find everything we needed. Otherwise, the room (we had a Junior Suite) was excellent. Very clean, good closet space, comfortable bath, great living and sleeping area. The bed was very comfortable! Pros: Beautiful, quiet hotel. Clean rooms, lobby and breakfast area. Great housekeeping service, cleans room when they're supposed to and also respect "do not disturb" sign on door. Central location. Bus and train nearby. Breakfast & evening drinks included for some room reservations. Cons: Cold front desk staff. Guests are sometimes treated like they're staying there for free. Staff seems to forget you're a paying guest. Housekeeping staff was friendlier. Restaurant - Inattentive, slow service. Waiters seen talking, laughing and even toasting and drinking among themselves while we waited for our order to be taken. It explains why the restaurant is always empty. Eat elsewhere. Charge for Wi-Fi service.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: SJJG
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic 30 second walk to Trevi Fountain, 5 mins to Spanish steps, 10 mins to Colloseum, Pantheon, Forum and about 20 to 25 mins walk to Vatican. This location suited us perfectly, there are bus stops a minute walk away and Metro Station Barberini is about 5 minutes away. The hotel is nicely decorated, our room was lovely, the breakfast was plentiful and good, the only very minor issue were that the staff were not very friendly you would walk past or wait at the desk and no one would greet you or make eye contact. This didn't impact our stay it was just something we noticed. I would stay here again and direct friends and family to stay here too as it's well priced for the area and has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPlats
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great location right near Trevi Fountain. The staff were helpful and gracious. The rooms were clean with all the facilities one would expect. The hotel is simple and modern. It does not have a lot of charm but the rooms are clean and more than adequate. Breakfast is served from 7 to 10:30. There are pastries, bread, cheese, ham, omelet, cereal, yogurt and fruits. We had a very pleasant stay and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: Daryna
Reviews.Content: We have just got married and decided to have a little 3-days honey moon trip to Rome. We stayed at Hotel Delle Nazioni and were very happy about our choice. You know, when you go to such cities as Rome, you don't realy need much, but a clean room with a nice bed. Location is something that makes your choice. And this hotel's location is perfect!!! It's just 50 metres away from the Trevi Fountain. It doesn't have a view to it, but still, it's very-very close. We were also able to walk from our hotel to any place of interest in Rome. We had a nice walk down to Coloseo and Emperor's Palace. We also walked back from St.Peter's, it's really not that far. Besides, walking around Rome is such a pleasure! Hotel's personnel were very friendly and helpful. Overall, the hotel is pretty basic: simple rooms (pretty dark, but very traditional Italian style), very simple breakfast, nothing fancy. So all good, we would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RParry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent four very enjoyable nights at the Hotel delle Nazioni in Rome and we very highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Firstly, the location is unbelievable. The Trevi Fountain is literally down the cobbled street, not even one minute's walk away. Yet being off down a laneway the hotel is surprisingly quiet and not too busy outside. The hotel itself is very nice, the closest we've seen to actually being 4 stars in Italy. The lobby is clean, comfortable and spacious. Likewise the rooms are a good size, and surprisingly modern. There was even a fantastic walk in closet in our room which meant we were not tripping over cases and could keep the room clear. The bed was comfortable, and whilst I found the pillows a bit flat/hard, my husband liked them so each to their own. One of the best things we found about the hotel is the great roof terrace which guests can enjoy. TIP: there's a great little supermarket that has all the food/drinks you can need immediately opposite the hotel. We spent many enjoyable hours on the terrace with great wine/prosecco which was a very cost efficient way to start the night!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: imikm
Reviews.Content: This hotel left me with a very bad feeling. We only stayed one night, our last night in Rome before flying home. At check, the gentleman was very rude and we were give rooms on the 1st floor which we weren't happy about. It was all they had so we took them. The rooms were smaller than we had at any other place we stayed. The floors had not been vaccuumed in the room or in the hallway outside or on the stairway. There was dirt and debris everywhere, it looked like they hadn't bothered to vacuum for days! The beds were smaller than we had at any other hotel and greatly used, as the mattress sagged in the middle. Our rooms were also dark with inadequate lighting at night. Bathroom felt unclean too like it needed a good scrubbing. For dinner, the front desk recommended a restaurant that turned out to be our worst experience in Italy. Very rude waiter which matched the attitude of the hotel staff. They must be friends. Location was close to all, but too crowded for my taste. I would not recommend this hotel to others and would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NunoMt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our vacation in Rome. The location is fabulous, close to everything and practically on top of Fontana di Trevi. The hotel is simple, modern, with everything you may need. Breakfast was good and enough to get you going. Would definitely stay there again if going back to Rome. It's a good value compared to a lot of expensive hotels that don't really deserve what they charge. We never took public transport to anywhere, we like experiencing the city on foot. We got a room facing the inside patio so there was no noise at night, but I believe that even the rooms that face the street must not get a lot of noise since the hotel is in a street that doesn't have a lot of traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, decent rooms, good rates”
Reviews.Author: Sanaea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just steps away from the Trevi Fountain and is right in the heart of the city. We had several kids in our group (the youngest was 4 and the oldest 11) and because of the central location, were able to walk everywhere - to the Colosseum/ Forums, to Piazza del Popolo/ Spanish Steps, the Pantheon, Piazza Novona. Everything is close by - the best shopping, good restaurants, even horse carriages. The reception and concierge staff are courteous and helpful; restaurant staff a bit business-like but not impolite. We had two connecting double rooms which were smallish but the other family with us had a triple room which was quite roomy with even a walk in wardrobe. Room service is a bit basic but there are many restaurants nearby. Even the Time Elevator is only a short walk away. All in all, this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ask for directions at the Hotel Delle Nazioni”
Reviews.Author: LJD115
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recieved pretty good reviews, but I was disappointed. First, while it is very centrally located, the neighborhood is touristy--like staying at Times Square. Central Rome is small and there are many pretty areas that are also centrally located. Second, whenver I asked for directions I had a map or brochure thrust in my hands. This happened several times, until I stopped asking. Third, I thought the breakfast was pretty awful--even the coffee wasn't good and this was Italy!.It wasn't surprising that their restaurant was always fairly empty, the breakfast was no advertisement for it. Third, my room was pretty small, which I understand when I get a single, and it had a terrace as large as the room. Unfortunately no effort was made to make the terrace attractive, it had one beat-up table and two chairs. Also, while the bathroom was good sized the shower was small, I think a large man (or woman for that matter) would be uncomrtable in it.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: thesmiledoc
Reviews.Content: Surprising great location! Mossimo the receptionist was excellent! Right near the Trevi fountain and walking distance to the forum, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: wegoaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on its location and we were a bit nervous on the state of the rooms after reading the more recent negative reviews. The location really triumphed everything else – we were able to walk to all the big sites in Rome and were able to come back during the day to freshen up if we wanted to! Everything was ~20 min walk in any direction from the hotel. We were also able to visit Trevi Fountain (1 minute walk!) early in the morning before the crowds of people arrived. The great thing about the hotel is that it was really close to Trevi (easy to find!) but on a side street so was quiet at night and even during the day! The rooms were outdated and the bathroom had an odd configuration. There was also a leak from the ceiling of the bathroom and the paint was chipping away. We were in a junior suite so had a corner room with windows facing [ ]. Our room was rather spacious with a separate sitting area. The room was nice and bright during the day, but at night was very dark as there were not enough lights in the room. The bed was hard and pillows flat but we were tired enough it didn’t matter much. There was both a shower and a bathtub with shower head and 2 sinks. Water pressure was good although the shower head was oddly positioned and splashed everywhere. As others have mentioned, they did include linens as handtowels and did not have face towels. Bath towels were cotton but really light (or worn) material. The hotel and rooms were non-smoking although we did find an ashtray in our room – thankfully no smell of smoke during our stay. We did wake up to some loud noises from the floor above us at 6am (sounded like furniture being dragged around) which was unpleasant. It is a busy hotel and was fully booked when we arrived. Front desk is hit or miss – the older gentlemen seemed to be more helpful than the younger staff. Everyone spoke English which was helpful as our Italian was unfortunantly non existant. We had almost gotten ripped off by a taxi driver coming in from the airport (btw it’s a fixed cost of 40 euros + 1 euro per piece of luggage – don’t let them convince you otherwise there’s a big sign in the airport and a sign on each cab!). When we asked the hotel staff, he was understanding of the taxi driver trying to over charge us and explained that anything under 60 euros was a good deal [despite the law that was passed on taxi drivers NOT overcharging)!!! Another hotel guest had gotten ripped off coming from Termini station (should be 15 euros). Breakfast was nothing to brag about although it was included in the room charge. Surprisingly, there were not many places to eat breakfast so the included breakfast was convenient although not tasty. There is a supermarket across the street (ask for Despar and not the convenient store next door as it is much cheaper at the supermarket) which we frequented quite often. We did find out that the hotel has a separate car service to the airport for only 50 euros – the driver was polite and on-time and efficiently got us to the airport in a roomy black Mercedes. You do have to remind the front desk on booking the car service though because the first guy we told forgot to actually reserve the car. All in all, loved the location which made the stay pleasant and memorable. Would recommend it to others with the caveat that the room will be outdated and dark at night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Buona23
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my daughter and friend and we could not find fault with any aspect of our stay. Check in was very efficient and the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was spotlessly clean and was very spacious for the 3 of us, we had a separate sitting area and walk in wardrobe area so we did not feel cramped in anyway. The hotel is situated right beside the Trevi Foutain, however we had a great sleep and heard no noise which was remarkable considering its location. The breakfast was included in the price and there was a fairly adequate choice of cereals, pastries etc as well as a choice of hot foods. We paid 260 euros for the night which was a bit pricier than some of the hotels we stayed in during our stay in Rome but I feel it was worth it as we had a very pleasant stay and I would definitely consider booking this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, unwelcoming reception”
Reviews.Author: Jules20
Reviews.Content: I got married at the beginning of June in Lake Como, then flew down to Rome for 4 nights for our honeymoon. We arrived, tired and late evening to be greeted with "name?" followed by being handed our room key. Not the welcome we had hoped for having just got married!! The rooms are clean, modern and have everything you need. The air con works well. However I was disappointed to note that the bottled water in the mini bar is well over priced. We paid over £180 per night to stay there (a reduced rate via expedia) and would expect water to be provided in the room. Breakfast was fine. The hotel is in a good location and is in walking distance of most attractions. What could be a very nice hotel in an ideal location was in my view let down by the most unwelcoming reception staff. I am afraid for me that soured my impression of the hotel - if I wasn't on honeymoon I might not have been so bothered!

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: jules3883
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here on our vacation to Italy. We stayed there 4 nights and had the worst experience. The hotel staff was very rude and wouldn't help with anything! When we checked in, they basically threw the key at us. The rooms were so dirty and had the worst bedding. The sheets felt like they were made out of rough paper. The bathroom was very dirty and the towels were so thin that wouldn't dry you off. We asked the hotel staff for directions and they wouldn't help. The breakfast which is included in the room rate is terrible! They had only packaged rolls and the coffee was from a coffee machine you would get at a gas station. After one night I wanted to leave Rome just because this hotel was so terrible. I do NOT recommend staying here ever!

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Hotel In A Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: Knowledgeable_One
Reviews.Content: We walked everywhere from the hotel it was saw that easy. The Hotel Concierge provided us with very details maps which made it impossible to get lost. One of the best things about this hotel was that it was literally only 30 seconds away from the Trevi Fountine. Hotel staff where every friendly and helpful when it came to booking the hop on and off sightseeing tickets. Breakfast in the hotel was great – lots to choose from. My room had a lovely private balcony which came as a total surprise as wasn’t expecting it.....great for relaxing after sightseeing and before dinner. We headed down to Piazza Navona for most evenings as the restaurants and live entertainments were excellent. We only stayed in Rome for 3 nights but wish i had longer....looking forward to going back soon and will defiantly stay at Hotel delle Nazioni again

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: SnapperLuton
Reviews.Content: We thought that the Hotel delle Nazioni was a very good choice for a short break in Rome. The staff were all very pleasant and efficient and helpful. The room we had was quite small, but adequate, furnished well enough, and had an extraordinarily large shower room for a hotel of this type. The air conditioning (necessary in June) was quiet and effective. No views from the window, though. Buffet breakfast was fine. The hotel's main advantage was it's location. Just a few yards from the Trevi fountain, a bit further to the Spanish steps. In fact we managed to walk to the Vatican City, and on another day to the Colloseum, although for a pair of pensioners it was a quite a long way! We took a taxi to the Vatican Museum as we had a pre-booked tour time (Well advised). And another day a trip using the (very limited) Metro system. It's worth noting that for EU citizens who are pensioners the City Museums (apart from the Vatican) are free on production of a passport (or copy). A number of restaurants are within a short walk of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: spottyladybird
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a good area in Rome. The man in the counter is very helpful but the hotel is not good. The room is so small, the air conditioning didnt work, bed feels unclean, very noisy and lot of people smoking. We did asked for quieter room and non-smoking. The room might be non-smoking but because the air conditioning didnt work we need to opne the window. Our room face the lane where everyone smoke. Room is nice for their food and visitation to the museum. But the country is very dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1sttriptorome
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been traveling for over 30 years throughout the US, Caribbean, and Mexico. This was our first trip to Europe. We had a wonderful time. While stuck at home due to 20 inches of snow on the ground, I started researching our trip. Went to expedia, entered our travel dates, and was given a list of hotels available. I then began to read trip advisor reviews on the hotels and selected this one due to the great reviews Check-in was the quickest we have ever experienced, and the porter was right there to take us to our room. I had read hotel rooms in Europe are smaller than the US. This was definitely true, but our room was fine for the two of us. The room was very clean, with nice hardwood floors, flat screen tv, mini-bar, safe, very comfortable bed and pillows, wooden shutters which kept out the street noise. The shower is very small. I read in one of the reviews that there would not be an iron in the room, so I took a travel iron. They do offer laundry services. Also, they do not provide hair conditioner, so bring your own. There is a nice terrace on the fifth floor. Breakfast was very good - scrambled eggs and bacon, a very tasty red orange juice, croissants, cereals, cold meats and cheese, good coffee, fresh and canned fruits, yogurt. This was included with our room rate. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The location of the hotel is great. We ended our evenings with a gelato at the Trevi Fountain. You can walk to most of the attractions. We did take a public bus to the Vatican, one euro each way. Very convenient, just ask someone at the front desk for the bus number and the location of the bus stop. There is a grocery store one block from the hotel if you want to get snacks/wine for your room. There are many restaurants very closeby. This was a great trip and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: parag_parekh
Reviews.Content: Good location, Average room sizes and concierge assistance. Avoid if you are vegeterian as there is not much choice for breakfast Look around the same area for similar hotels. Average VFM.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, excellent location but a bit pricey!”
Reviews.Author: GardenerJim
Reviews.Content: Excellent location behind the Trevi fountain, but still very quiet. Clean and nicely decorated room. Varied and tasty buffet breakfast. Helpful reception staff. BUT - having just stayed in a 5 star hotel in Cardiff for £120 per night, spending more than £200 per night for a hotel with fewer amenities seemed a bit steep. I know Rome is expensive and the euro isn't helping at the moment, but nevertheless... So ... there's a SPAR shop just behind the hotel if you don't want to spend out on the mini bar and a really reasonable restaurant just a couple of streets away called L'Archetto in Via Archetto! Some good trips - Dark Rome's guided tour to Ostia Antica - excellent guide called Massimo who brought the site to life - Beautiful Bernini sculptures at Galleria Borghese, but you need to book in advance for a timed entry slot (phone or online) - Doria Pamphili pallazo has beautiful rooms and lovely art, and a great audio guide.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Amazing Location. Don't hesitate, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: so_so_much_to_see
Reviews.Content: As all the other reviews have stated, this hotel has a fantastic location - everything we wanted to see in Rome was within walking distance. The Metro is only a short walk away and is very user-friendly. The hotel rooms are modern, clean and comfortable - the air conditioning is fantastic in hot weather. The hotel provided a lovely breakfast with plenty of choice of hot and cold options. The staff were helpful. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel (in fact I have done to my family). Stop worrying - just book it!! You won't find better 4 star for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Beautifully Simple Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaPlanner
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat--it is directly behind the Trevi Fountain, which makes it so easy to locate for anyone traveling to Rome for the first time. Whenever I needed to find my way home after a day of exploring, I could ask anyone on the street to point me in the direction of the Trevi Fountain...it was perfectly central to everything I did. The rooms were recently remodeled with beautiful hardwood floors and marble bathrooms. I had a twin room, and it was a very good size for a European hotel room. We had a window that opened to an interior courtyard--beautiful! I would absoutely stay here again the next time I am able to go to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “very pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: Magelan48
Reviews.Content: We were two couples staying in this hotel for 5 nights. The location is great. Just 1 minute from Fontana di Trevi. Modern rooms very rich buffet for breakfast. Helpful English speaking staff . When the double glazed windows are shut, no noise is heard. In conclusion we will be happy to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Delle Nazioni - Excellent location, let down by reception team”
Reviews.Author: 43iiainbw
Reviews.Content: We stayled in the hotel for a family short break. The location is fantastic as you can walk to major sires from hotel. The rooms are clean and have all you need for your stay. The reception staff could be more welcoming .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: didikaki
Reviews.Content: Great Location Friendly staff we were even offered to see a british football game. Rooms very clean Definetely will return

Reviews.Title: “the perfect getaway !”
Reviews.Author: Manolis_Louk
Reviews.Content: I had a 3day journey in Rome with my love,for dedicating time to ourselves. The hotel is wonderful,nice furnishing,cleanliness,service. It is close to the monuments,has also a subway station so everything is reachable. The staff very polite,Rome always gorgeous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JWCinVA
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with Airline miles. The location could not be better. A bout 1 minutes walk from Tervi Fountain. Staff was great. Roomes were typically small for this part of twon, but clean and comfortable. Excellent buffett breakfast included. Internet connection was a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gathpode
Reviews.Content: I stopped at this Hotel with my wife while my son and his friend also had a seperate room. We arrived on Monday 15th of Feb at not quite 21.00. My son had changed his room option to 2 single beds with his tour operator but guess what they had not told the Hotel even though they said they would. No problems the Hotel sorted it out Thanks Daniele. What else is there to say about this Hotel. This was our first time in Rome and we chose it because of it`s location. It is just a few hundred feet from the Trevi fountain. I am so glad I did. Daniele on the front desk is a fantastic guy, friendly helpful and very patient. My wifes priest had arranged tickets for a Papal audience on Ash Wednesday but we did not know the time as when we looked at our instructions there was no time. There was no information on the Vatican website. Daniele did not give up though and he rang the Vatican and found everything out for us thanks again Daniele. The porter who carried our bags was also a fantastic guy with a smile that would light up our day ( I think my wife secretly fancied him). He really was a treat to chat to. The cleaning ladies deserve a mention for the way they looked after our room and always with a Bonjourno in the morning. I would say the staff at this Hotel are attentive friendly and made our trip all the more enjoyable. There was a bit of road noise even though our room was on the side overlooking a quiet alleyway but what the heck we were in the middle of a busy city a couple of grappas soon sorted it out. Would I stop in this Hotel again if in Rome. I would be dissappointed not to. The breakfasts were good with plenty of choice. I could not find any big faults with the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and location should be rated as 4+ star”
Reviews.Author: rayoflightcanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days and I choose this hotel based on the trip advisor reviews after 2 weeks of search, I was not surprised by the quality and service, very professional classy staff, rooms are excellent, clean, bathroom all marble, towels are clean and changed every day. Breakfast was excellent selection all you wanted from scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, fresh tasty croissant (jam or custard filled), butter, jam and all kind of breads, cheese, cold cut meats, fresh fruits and caned, fresh cappuccino available on request. Location is the best; literally the Fontana De Trevi is the hotel backyard, less than 1 minute walk, all other attractions and 15-20 minutes’ walk. And above all the Galleria Alberto Sordi is just behind the hotel and there is a taxi stand as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all travelers and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended due to central location day & night to tourist sights”
Reviews.Author: time2share
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, 1 couple, 1 single, 2 adults sharing a double, The single room was good size but the shower was so tiny he could hardly turn around, both the other double rooms with good bathrooms. The 2 adults sharing had 3 twin beds in the room. They had wonderful taxi service on the corner, need to advise front desk to call for taxi ahead. They had a free breakfast buffet each morning, self service. Fr esh cappuchino, expressos upon request. Or the american coffee from a machine. Wonderful chocolate croisants fresh each morning.Location a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a week in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JRock2
Reviews.Content: We booked through expedia for a very inexpensive junior suite with breakfast included. Great location. The hotel was very generous to allow us to check in early in the morning at no extra cost. Claudio was wonderful for bringing us fresh coffee every morning as soon as we sat down. Front desk staff always welcoming and helpful if we had a question. Although the room faced the busy street, the shutters, windows and curtains were sufficient to minimize the noise at night. Perhaps the others that complained about the noise didn't know how to shut the window arrangements properly. The only complaint we had would be the private pickup at the airport. We reserved a pickup at least one week before our arrival, but the driver never showed up at FCO. When I called the hotel after almost half an hour, they offered to send someone then. We decided to grab the shuttle which was fine and cheaper. Great city, beautiful architecture, delicious food, great wine and unbelievable art. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: Leighsarah
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days in Rome staying at Hotel delle Nazioni. The rooms are nicely furnished and quite a good size for Europe, in fact would say the bathroom was huge for Europe. The Trevi is literally yards away, and the hotel is perfectly placed for seeing all the sights. Staff were always helpful and professional, even doing a copy of my daughter's passport when I asked advise about museum admission for Students. A couple of 24hrs shops really close by to get a snack or drink for the room. Only criticism would be our room was not exactly quiet (faced the road) and would have liked a information sheet in the room about the Hotel, eg - times for breakfast, what channels available on tv, did wonder thought if this was simply missing from our room. Very clean, very comfortable would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: LA_Travelers_1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights over Christmas 2009. The only good things I can say about this hotel is that the location was great (1 block from Trevi Fountain) and when we arrived at 9:00 AM in the morning they let us check in. The room was decent sized, but you needed to be a contortionist to use the shower. Also the towels for wiping your hands are like napkins. The breakfast (which was included) was mediocre at best - the croissants were okay but the bacon was only partially cooked. What I really didn't like was the indifference shown to us. We spent (what I consider) a decent amount of $ - about $200/night for 5 nights and when we went to check out, the cashier couldn't have been a bigger sour puss. My husband asked to see the bill before he handed over his credit card and she snapped at him. After he paid the bill, she ignored us - no thank you - no nothing! I realize that customs are different from the States but when I spend a $1,000, I think I deserve at least a thank you and some nice parting words. I guess that was too much to expect from this hotel. Needless to say we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for central Rome!”
Reviews.Author: onedumgoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have been to Rome many times, and most of the 3 star hotels and many of the 4 star hotels are dumps. It's very much like New York City, where the rooms get a lot of use and are not kept up. Basically, anything less than 4 stars and chances are high that it will be dumpy. With 4 star hotels, it's a crap shoot, but this one is a great choice. It's clean, roomy, and the staff is most helpful. In addition, the breakfast is good and it includes hot and cold foods, plus lots of fresh fruit. Best of all, the location is great. Take a room facing the interior courtyard for total peace and tranquility. You can walk out the front and you are 100 yards to Trevi Fountain. From there, you can be at the Plaza Navona or the Spanish Steps in less than 15 minutes on a liesurely walk. You can't beat it. We were there in Dec., so i'm not sure how well the a/c works, which i know is important if you go in July. Room size is decent and the bathroom is actually large for Rome. This is a good value and a nice place!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: marwan1975
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a nine days vaccation in rome,stayed at delle nazioni,which was one of the best parts of our vaccation. location is unbeatable,i don,t think you can find better.all major attractions, museums,historical places are within walking distant.we walked everywhere,even we walked our way back from vatican. lot of good restaurents are around .allegro pacchino,le lanterne,pizza ciro, al pecchio are very good and reasonably cheap,with excellent house wine. small grocery is just at the door,sometimes it is very useful. the sorrounding area looks very safe at night,we returned back late from our dinner 2 or3 times,we found all the streets well lightened,people walking normally . hotel overall is very clean,modern furniture.room is larger than most similar in europe. breakfast was excellent,many items to choose between,very good cappochino(ask the waiter to prepare it fresh). front desk people were all perfect and professinal especially mr salvatore.answered all our questions,and were ready to do whatever we asked for.arranged florence trip with very nice early breakfast box,recommended agood dinner with show in centrale restotheatre,and arranged for airport transfer. overall..our experience was fantastic. rome is a magneficent charming city,and staying in such excellent hotel will make your days better. this hotel is highly recommended,we will deffinetely stay here again in our next visit to bella roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: acme20
Reviews.Content: Stayed Nov 19-23. One of the reasons I chose this hotel was based not only on the many good reviews I had read but the fact that the management of this property took the time to respond to reviews (both positive and negative) I found that to be quite refreshing. I can say I was not disappointed at all!. The hotel is perfectly situated for touring and the breakfast was more than adequate to start your day off on a good note. Management was attentive, friendly and helpful ....recommending places to eat, arranging transportation to the airport etc. If I had anything to request it would be for more english language stations as it would have been nice after along day to watch something on the TV other than CNN or BBCNews - But honestly I cant complain! I would easily recommend this hotel to family and friends and will stay here again the next time we are in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: GissellaG
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good breakfast. Everything around the corner. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great experience”
Reviews.Author: time_traveller81
Reviews.Content: We are both just back from Rome yesterday and I have to say that this hotel defintely helped make the trip very enjoyable. This hotel is situated literally 1 minute walk away from Trevi Fountain. It is an amazing location. You can walk anywhere really from it but we used the Metro line a lot of the time as it is the cheapest way to get around. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted straight away by concierge and checked in immediately. We were given a great room on the 5th floor with a lovely terrace over looking the street that runs up to the Trevi Fountain. The room was very clean and a good size for European hotels and the terrace defintely made the difference. There is a mini bar stocked with lots of different drinks if you fancy one. The only one thing that I would say that the room lacked was the lack of information for sights and tourist information. But you could get this information downstairs. Apart from that the room was great. The Breakfast is a buffet style with a huge variety of food to choose from. It goes on to 10.30 which gives you good time if you fancy a lie in. The staff in the hotel are qute friendly and there English is good. But in particular I want to mention the guy from concierge (can remember name). He could not have been more helpful at all times. We needed a cable to charge our camera and I asked at reception if there was a shop to buy one and the concierge guy told me that he had one in his car and he give us it to use for the whole trip. I was very impressed by this as it saved us buying a cable that would not work over here in UK. All in all I can only say pretty positive things about this hotel but one thing that did suprise me was the fact that there are no irons in the rooms and to iron clothes you have to pay for housekeeping to do it and it cannot be done in the evenings. I am not sure if this is the norm for european hotels but I would have all clothes ironed before you go. If I was going back to Rome I would defintely stay in this hotel again as it is a reasonable price, good service, very clean and a good breakfast to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure would stay here next time!”
Reviews.Author: nikeexplore
Reviews.Content: Certainly brilliant location and clean, fairly comfortable hotel but quite basic really for over £200 a night(inclusive of breakfast and taxes). Staff polite but not particularly engaging and rooms did not have a basic welcome/information leaflet. Not quite sure what made it a four star and not three. Breakfast was reasonably as was the lunch buffet which we had once. Selling point is the location!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: kjtraveler2008
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel delle Nazioni over Labor Day. We stayed for 7 nights and had an amazing time. We got in late on Saturday night and the Concierge was literally waiting for us (or made it seem that way) and was welcoming when we arrived; he even knew our name. Our rooms were clean and in an absolute perfect location. Literally 30 seconds from Trevi Fountain, 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps and shops, and about 10-15 minutes from the Coliseum. We never had to take a bus! It was about a 15 minute walk to the Pantheon and about 20-25 from Piazza Navona. The hotel was lovely. Our first night we stayed in a room facing the street and it was a bit noisy as there is some construction going on across the way. We talked to the front desk and they moved all our stuff for us when we were out and about; our new room faced the courtyard and was fabulous. Everything was fantastic. The breakfast was great and the day after arriving we were super jet lagged so they even brought us a tray so we could load up and take it back to our room. Overall the staff really tried to accomodate us as and did so on every front. They even let us emailed our tour tickets and then printed them for us. We would absolutely stay here again the next time we're in Rome; everything about the hotel was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trundler
Reviews.Content: Recently Spent 5 nights at the Delle Nazione . As most people have said , the location is spot on. about 30 seconds stroll from the Trevi Fountain and not far from any of the other major locations either. Metro station (barberini) about 5/10 mins up the road if needed. Room size good & the safes are free to use. Reception staff were great & the breakfast has everything you need to set you up for the day - usual continental + eggs & bacon for those who like something hot. Has a little supermarket just opposite for any essentials needed before a days sightseeing & once the shutters are closed , all noise is gone so no probs sleeping. Would stay here again as 1st choice, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: crazyseg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nazioni for my boyfriend and I's first trip to Rome and chose it based on its central location. Its location is great and no more than 30-45 minutes walk from the main attractions. Our room was small, and the beds quite hard as you usually get in European countries, but it overlooked an inner courtyard so we had no noise. As mentioned in other reviews, the breakfast is not amazing but did the job. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant as it seemed quite expensive, but being in such a central area there is plenty of choice nearby. The staff were all friendly, and happy to help if it was needed. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more and we usually do!”
Reviews.Author: kimpressive
Reviews.Content: After a lovely stay in Venice and a so-so stay in Florence, we spent 5 perfect nights in Rome at the Delle Nazione. As others have said, the Trevi Fountain is so close you can almost hear it, and we walked to every major site from the ruins to the Spanish steps to the Pantheon, and on and on. The breakfast was lovely each day (complimentary), although one other reviewer mentioned that the coffee is from a machine and was answered that "real" coffee and cappucino are also available. They are, but nobody offers them. When we asked, we received them, but would have had no inkling that it was possible if we hadn't read other reviews. We were the only ones in the breakfast room drinking cappucino as a result! Small point, though. Our room was beautiful, with marble bathroom, sitting area and separate bedroom, although we only booked a regular room at a great price. I can't speak for the other rooms, but ours was on a corner. We liked opening the windows and shutters to watch the world go by and to get some fresh air, but when we closed them, we couldn't hear traffic at all. The air conditioning was heavenly. When we return to Rome, we'll return to the Delle Nazione.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: gemandreg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Delle Nazioni from 14 August 2009 to 17 August 2009 and we couldn't have picked a better hotel! Its about 30 minutes at the most transfer from the Fiumicino Airport (Leonardo Da Vinci). The hotel is beautiful it is on a lovely quiet side street that leads down to the Trevi Fountain, literally not even a two minute walk. The gentlemen on reception were very helpful. We stayed in room 318 and it was perfect. The bed was huge, the room, the bedding and the bathroom was spotless. The shower was great, there were two sinks which came in handy when we were both trying to get ready at the same time and also a bidet. There was a safe which I personally was very pleased about just for storing jewellery and passports etc. There is also air con which came in very handy in the August heat wave, there’s a TV and a mini bar. The view from our window was the courtyard and the shutters that were on the windows were brilliant especially if you needed an afternoon nap, which we did once or twice after exploring in the morning because the heat was unbelievable, but a very welcomed change from the weather in the UK. Everything we wanted to see while were there was in close proximity, we walked everywhere except to the Vatican where we got a taxi which cost 8 euros. Always haggle taxis because even though it only costs us 8 euros to get to the Vatican we asked a driver when we were ready to leave how much and he said 18 euros so we said no chance and asked another taxi driver and he charged 10 euros. Just a last note to say that we went at the time we did for a specific occasion and after we’d booked we found out that the 15th August is a bank holiday but there is no need to let that put you off because as far as we could see everything was open, that we needed anyway. Everything about Rome is wonderful, the people, the food, the shopping and especially the sights. Just be careful of the roads!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CarloBarb
Reviews.Content: Very good location, we walked to everything. The complimentary breakfast every morning was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and a nice room”
Reviews.Author: One_vacation22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days in July. We had a double superior room, which gave us a slightly larger room. The room was very clean and the bed (2 twins put together) was comfy. The central location made it easy to walk everywhere. Most of the restaurants in the area are a little touristy, however you can walk for a bit and find some nice local places. The hotel staff was helpful, however they couldn't recommend a walking tour company. (They only recommend the Green line tours which are not walking tours)The breakfast was great, yogurt, cheese, meat, hardboiled eggs, ceral, juice, coffee, tea, a great assortment of breakfast pastries, fruit cocktail, applesauce, prunes and the addition of scrambled eggs and bacon was a nice treat . We had a great time in Rome and having a nice hotel to come home to everynight was part of the magic,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value”
Reviews.Author: drdave91
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern rooms with hard wood floors, modern baths, the accommodations were charming. And the location is fabulous. Walk out the front door and turn right and you are 100 yards from the Trevi Fountain. Turn left and you are a short block from Via Tritone and access to the city's extensive bus service. The front desk staff is pleasant and helpful. The continental breakfast might be my only area of complaint. The selection of breads, pastries, meats and cheeses is adequate and typical for European hotels but the coffee is provided by an dispensing machine that will be disappointing to anyone who likes to begin their day with a cup of fresh brew. Happily, there are any number of cafes nearby where a better cup of coffee can be gotten before you start your day.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in Rome, postion brilliant, staff superb”
Reviews.Author: gaydave
Reviews.Content: Hi, have just returned yet again from Rome my favorite City. Found this hotel after a search and reading the reviews, can only say they are all correct, from our check in ( 10.30 ) early, they took our luggage, offered to keep our other stuff in the safe, then directed us to the Trevie Fountain 45 meters away. Returned at midday to our room...410 on the road, huge with walk in wardrobe, safe, big bathroom very modern 2 sinks/bidet recently renovated, mini bar.... Breakfast was as expected, cold meats, cereasl, tea/coffee and juices, boiled and scrambled eggs, bacon....on and on, anybody says no good never stayed here. All the staff superb, very helpfull, both day and night. Used the hotel Limo to Da Vinci airport at 8am, 50 euro well worth it BIG new Mercades Limo, took care of all our luggage. Could go on but run out of compliments. Returning in October for sure

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: AtulKacker
Reviews.Content: Location: Great location - close to the Trevi Fountain (1 min walk) but on the quiet side so little noise from crowds. Easy to walk everywhere from here or catch a bus - bus station less than 5 mins walk. Shopping areas on Via del Condotti etc within walking distance. Hotel: We had a room with a king size bed for us and a single for our teenage son and room size was OK. Bathroom was clean. Sheets were changed everyday. Breakfast was fine - eggs, toast, croissants, sliced meats, fruit, tea, coffee and the dining room was pleasant. Internet available in the room (didn't try it) and one computer available in the lobby for a fee. Staff generally helpful - maid was very good despite our difficulties in communicating in Italian. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The most magical and wonderful stay ever”
Reviews.Author: oriana34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned 2 days ago from our wedding anniversary long weekend away. We stayed at the Delle Nazioni for 3 nights. I have to say it is by far the best hotel we have stayed in in europe. Most hotels rate themselves as being a 4 star, but this hotel certainly was. As you approach the hotel you are greeted by the friendliest and helpful bellboy / concierge. Who onced dropped our luggage in our beautiful room, proceeded to tell us of the places we must visit and how to get there. As we arrived at the hotel at 10:30pm, it was still early enough to go and explore what was around us. Was really pleased to find that the Trevi Fountain was litterally 1 minutes walk from the hotel. Even at that time of night it was buzzing, with people hanging out around the fountain, holding hands, eating gelato (icecream) and basicly chilling out. The hotel is so central that you can walk litterally to all the famous site, although you will come home completely exhausted. The hotel is very clean and modern. The rooms were cleaned every day to a high standard. The breakfast was a nice surprise with egg, bacon, cold meats cheeses, croissant, cakes, juices coffee and tea. Enough to last you till late into the afternoon. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We would definately love to come back to Rome as we thought that 2 days was not enough to see everything. We will return to the Delle Nazioni, as it is by far the best 4star hotel that rome has to offer. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cminny
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three days in Rome after a week in Tuscany and were quite pleased with Hotel delle Nazione. The best feature is its central location down the block from the Trevi Fountain and within walking distance of Ancient Rome, the Storico Centro, and other tourist destinations. The service was very helpful and friendly. For example, when we checked in the porter noticed our air conditioning was not working and called the front desk to get us a new room. When none of the ATMs would give us cash to pay for our taxi to the airport on our way home, they issued us a cash advance for the taxi. Best of all was having air conditioning, which helped us recuperate after exhausting days in the heat and humidity and intense sunshine of the Roman summer. One negative: although the breakfast was good enough -- pastries, some cheese and ham, fruit, eggs -- coffee was produced by machine with the only choices being American style coffee or pre-sweetened "cappucino." Given the high quality of espresso in Italy, that was a bit of a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Trevie adventure”
Reviews.Author: Reno12
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel for a trip with your granddaughter...50 yards from the Trevie Fountain... Which my granddaughter loved, everyday we, grandfather,grandmother and granddaughter had Treve and Gelito...Perfect.....The room was also perfect...The staff---- Salvatore Lamonaca and Massimo Nobili are teh most perfect people...They made the stay perfect..You always felt welcome... Would I stay again...Absolutely

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent service and a BIG thanks to the reseptionist and Govanni!!”
Reviews.Author: Saikkuli
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this htl well in advance in order to attend the Fitness Festival in May after being in Rimini a few days earlier. When we arrived to Florence it so appeared that the festival had already been held a week earlier! We arrived May 19th and the reseption guy was extremelly helpful -he even telephoned friends to find out more information about the festival (dates, location etc)! I asked if we could stay just the first night and cancel the rest ( 4 nights), as we had arrived for nothing practically. Of course he couldn´t make up the decision so he gave us the assisting manager´s name who would be working the next morning (Govanni). The next morning I told Govanni about our mistake in dates and he was extremelly helpful in making sure we could cancel our other nights free of charge. He and I called the hotel reservation company (hotels.com ...) to make sure that it was OK. Govanni promised us a cancellation free of charges, so did the reservation company! Then we went back to Rimini for the rest of our stay. I have not received a refund yet ( been 1,5 weeks now) and shall e-mail the reservations company soon, if it does not show up. I must say that the service I received from the reseptionist ( a very nice guy) and from Govanni was absoloutely PERFECT!! They both where genuin and really wanted to serve! The hotel is located right next to the main railway station and the shopping area is very close by. Excellent location, clean hotel. Thaks Delle Nazioni! Regards, Sari from Finland

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janre
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights, it was really great, spotlessly clean, and the best location. It is just down the street from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps and the Pantheon are an easy walk. There is a lot of little stores in the area to buy sandwiches and water. The breakfast in the hotel was really nice, everything you could want , eggs, bacon, cheese,ham,juice all sorts of great bread. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: slk176
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location, as other reviews have described. My mum and I walked everywhere that we wanted to go. The Vatican was probably the furthest away but only took us around 30 minutes on foot. Additionally the advantages of exploring Rome by walking are plenty, there are so many hidden gems around every corner. There also seemed to be plenty of buses, and a metro nearby. The room itself was spacious, with a large bathroom with two sinks! We had a shower over a bath, which was very powerful. The room was very clean and had spare pillows, blankets etc. It was noisy with our window open - we were overlooking the restaurant, and the nearby main road - but when the window was shut it reduced the noise well. The staff were really friendly, and the breakfasts were typical continental style. We were really impressed with how quiet it was during breakfast, having had previous experience in a canteen style enviornment. I would stay there again happily.

Reviews.Title: “Central and convenient”
Reviews.Author: bjh1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a short visit to Rome. The hotel is amazingly convenient to most of the sights in both the ancient and medieval city. It is only thirty metres or so from the Trevi Fountain and within walking distance of pretty well everywhere but the Vatican City. The hotel is five floors in an evidently very old building which has been modernised without losing too much of its character. The quite large room and en suite bathroom were comfortable and clean. The room was at the rear of the hotel overlooking a courtyard. Rooms at the front of the hotel might be a little noisier until later in the evening due to the proximity of the Trevi fiountain. A disadvantage for someone from Northern climes was that the air conditioning was not working very effectively and we spent the first part of the night with windows thrown open, but by the end of the night were under blankets. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom did not have a bath but a large shower enclosure, which proved adequate for a short visit. Breakfast comprised a large and varied buffet, including scrambled and boiled eggs, and bacon, as well as a great variety of cold meats, cheeses, breads and fruit. More than enough to set you up for the day and included in the rate. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel for meals at other times of the day, but there are plenty of eating opportunities nearby, although care in choosing will help avoid poor value for money. The staff could have been a little more friendly but were efficient nonetheless. Rack rates were very high but using a booking web site gave us a considerably better deal than we would have got direct from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: emcat
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of booking this hotel. It was awful and I truly doubt it s a four-star hotel- three at best. My room had an electrical problem and I had no electricity. The hotel's response to this was to send up an elderly porter who would click the circuit breaker on and then five - ten minutes later the lights would go out again. This went on from the time I checked in through the night. and next morning. Staff was not accomodating and told me there was nothing they could do until the following afternoon. I checked out the next morning after spending an night in a room with no electricity. Secondly, the room was so small for a standard double. There was only 2 feet bewteen the end of the bed and the wall. When you opened the door, the bathroom was directly in front of you and it was extremely small. Cleanliness was moderate. Comfort did not exist. I would not stay here if the room was free. DON'T STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: sjkatlaw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Nazioni for five nights. There are so many hotels in Rome that making a decision on where to stay feels like a shot in the dark, particularly since Rome hotels range from expensive to coma-inducing sticker shock. We relied heavily on Tripadvisor and got what we expected. Nazioni is located next to Trevi Fountain, but it does not overlook the fountain or suffer from the Fountain's 24-hour mob scene. The hotel is very conveniently located as a central place to walk to any attraction in old Rome. We only used public transportation to get up to the Borghese Gallery and to the Vatican. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the nearest metro station. Our room was as expected - small, tight and functional. We asked for and received a room facing the courtyard that was relatively quiet. The hotel first offered to upgrade us to a suite on the roof, which is big and has spectacular views. Unfortunately, the room was not non-smoking so it reeked. We asked for a non-smoking room and ended up with what we paid for - a non-smoking small room facing the courtyard. The service staff made up our room daily. The sheets and bathroom were clean. The shower was particularly small - smaller than any other showers we've experienced in Europe. We spent very little time at our hotel in Rome since we were there to see the sights, so for sleeping, cleaning and breakfast purposes, this hotel works. The morning breakfast is plentiful and not bad. Nothing fancy and certainly not four star, but it has variety and fresh food that satisfied. The hotel is fairly large, so expect to see a lot of tourists around. Not recommended for anyone that expects their hotel to enhance a romantic getaway. There was always at least one person at the front desk and they all spoke English well and were helpful. Laundry here is very expensive - in fact, laundry everywhere in Rome is expensive, so your money is better spent on buying extra or new clothing. Although our room was non-smoking and indeed did not smell, the rest of the hotel had a strong smoke odor - not surprising since most of the tourists we encountered were European or Asian (few Americans). For the price, you could probably do better than Nazioni, but you could certainly do worse. We left with no major complaints and no lasting memories of Nazioni - pretty much what we expected and all we could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great ....”
Reviews.Author: Life_in_the_city
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Hotel delle Nazioni. Pros Room clean. Quiet from the outside world. Location ok, but in a real tourist area. Decor of the room, pleasing. Cons Cleaners - loud Aircon - very loud, and didn't seem to work. Breakfast - limited for a 4 star hotel; actually felt a bit ill after every meal TV - I appreciate you come to Rome not to watch the TV in your room ... but it was cold and wet and I was a solo traveller, so sometimes, being in your room to watch a bit of tellie not a bad option - only had about 5 very fuzzy italian stations ... no pay TV or DVD rental option. Kind of annoying actually. They could improve their entertainment system. Shower cubicle - so small!!! I had to shower with the doors open and I'm a size 10!! so who knows how a man would fit. Staff - A couple of nice staff members at front desk, but the older lady in the evening shift ... rude. Just really rude. I would look elsewhere than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Not Trustworthy Housekeepers”
Reviews.Author: CPV35
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon and had a great time at the hotel. We stayed at this hotel for 8 days / 7 nights and our room was located on the 3rd floor. I would have given this a 5 but we had several issues. Let me start off with the good news. The hotel is literally near the Trevi Fountain... about a 30 second walk. You cannot hear all the noise from the crowds which is great. This is pretty much walking distance from all the site seeing monuments except for The Vatican (which we took the Metro). The hotel was up to date and sort of trendy. The concierge, registration, and bellmen were very nice and helpful. The rooms were always clean and tidy. The A/C worked but we kept it off since it was cooler at nights and we always kept the drapes closed. We only used the free continental breakfast twice. The eggs and bacon reminded me of a Las Vegas hotel buffet. Don't know if you want to count that as good or bad. Now for the bad news. We had 2 issues: the noise in the morning and our "mysterious" disappearing clothes. In the morning around 9am, you can hear housekeeping moving the furniture around everyday like clock-work. It's the same noise you hear when you move a wooden chair across a wooden floor with the vibration. Well, that kept us up since we were still jet-lagged. The second issue was on our 7th day there. We got back from shopping near the Spanish Steps and realized that ALL of our personal stuff on the desk has been rearranged. Not a big deal but after 6 days of not moving our personal items around, this day was different. My Timothy Ferris book was now on the nightstand table instead of the main desk (remember it hasn't moved in 6 days from the desk). Our dirty clothes were moved around (we had stacked them in piles) and my wife's shoes / slippers were rearranged... except for her Nike shoes (the ones that has 4 springs on the heel). We literally found them behind the drapes we never opened. Her Nike's were originally with all her shoes and slippers. That was not all... When we got back to LA on Wednesday, we wanted to separate the clothes for laundry and noticed that her Banana Republic skirt was missing. We always make it a habit to comb through the room when we leave any hotel room and we obviously combed through this room since we do live 6000+ miles away. We called the hotel (an international call, no 800#) at 12pm PST Thurs (which was 9pm Thurs in Rome) to let them know that we "left a skirt in our room" and they said to call back tomorrow morning. I called back at 11pm PST (which was 8am Friday) and the receptionist said he will find out with housekeeping and to call back in 30 minutes. My 3rd call back just told me that housekeeping found "nothing". This hotel is managed by ReMar Hotel and I tried to file a complaint but nothing was on their website except for the hotel's information. That won't do anything for us. All in all, the hotel deserved a 5 for its location, 4 for their concierge, registration, and bellmen, and a 0 for their housekeeping. We're just glad that all of our valuables were put in our in-room safe and nothing else was taken. For being a 4 star hotel, I would have thought this kind of thing wouldn't happen.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel With Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Fussy08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Delle Nazioni between 4-10th August. We had a great week at this hotel. We could not have picked a better hotel. The location is brilliant everything is in walking distance. Everything of interest is not more than a 20 minute leisurely walk and i mean leisurely. The trevi fountain is at the end of the street, about 50 steps. Everyone says that Rome is quiet during the summer because all the Romans disappear and let me tell you this had me worried at the beginning of my holiday. Sure a lot of the little tobacco shops were closed but we didnt even notice. Tourist shops are aplenty, restaurants were all open and all the sights were open. Tours of the city and Italy still run every day. The Manager of the hotel, was kind enough and booked all of our tours through Green Line Tours and everything went off without a hitch. The bus for the tours was always on time and the lovely staff even brought us a breakfast bag each before our long 3hr coach journey to Florence. The breakfast were excellent nearly everything you can imagine, Cheese, hams, eggs, bacon, croissants, cereals, fruit, toast etc. The room itself was perfect for us, however there was no iron which we would have liked. We cannot thank Hotel Delle Nazioni enough for our stay. Chiave 106

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: maryjo_7
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay in this hotel between 16th and 22nd August 2008. It is perfectly located for a visit to Rome, being within easy walking distance of many of the main visitor atttractions, and with easy access to transport links to further away sights. The Trevi fountain is literally 1 minute walk away, the Spanish steps, the Pantheon and the Piazza Venetia only 5 minutes walk away. There is a supermarket directly across the street, and another about 100 mtrs away. There is an ATM next door and another straight across the road. The hotel is very quiet, it has a bar and restaurant attached but they weren't very busy while I was there. I did eat in the restaurant one evening and was very satisfied with the food and the service. Breakfast was continental buffet-style, with scrambled eggs and bacon available. Very satisfying. The hotel also provide breakfast boxes to take away if you are taking a day-trip with an early mornign start - you just need to arrange it with reception. My room was very comfortable, although it was quite small. The bathroom had a shower cubicle, but no bath. There was hot water available all day long. The bed linen and towels were changed every day. The reception staff all spoke good English and were very pleasant and helpful. My one complaint is that my room overlooked a side street and there were lorries and vans and workmen making a racket every morning from before 7:00am. They were working on renovation of a building further on down the street so they aren't a permanent fixture. It wasn't a big deal really as, to get the most out of a visit to Rome, you need to be up and out early anyway. I would definitely stay here again and would have no hesitation in recommending Hotel Delle Nazioni to others.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveMH
Reviews.Content: We had a three day stay at this hotel, the best we have stayed in, perfect location to explore the city, seconds from the Trevi fountain, we walked everywhere from the hotel. The rooms were spotless, and the marble bathroom was beautiful with bath, shower and double basins. I believe the hotel has been renovated in the last couple of years and boy what a great job they have made of it ! Breakfast was in a continental self-serve style but the variety and quantity was astonishing, allowing us to try all sorts of typical Italian foods along with familiar items. We had a triple room set on the corner of the 3rd floor with really large shuttered windows, the single bed was set in a divided room with sliding doors with its own TV table etc, The double bed was enormous!!! When we were there the average temperatures exceeded 36 degrees and we really appreciated the excellent air conditioning system throughout the hotel and particularly in our own room, a haven when things got really warm.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sangria14
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the best location possible. Literally 20 steps from the Trevi fountain, but it's on a side street so its not noisy. Ask for a quiet room like we did and you'll get one facing the courtyard. Its a 5 minute walk to the Pantheon and a 10 minute walk to the Spanish steps. You can also walk to the Colluseum but it will take you about 20 minutes. The hotel staff is extremely helpful. The rooms are spotless. The beds are really firm, but this has been a common experience for me in Italy (I like soft beds). The breakfast is fine. Don't listen to the bad reviews on this site - I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “South Beach Style in Fab ulous Roma”
Reviews.Author: alohav55
Reviews.Content: Wow! This Hotel has it all!!! Great location near Trevi Fountain! Spotless, comfortable rooms and great marble bath. Quite modern for an ancient city. Front desk extremely nice ! Fun breakfast with a wide assorment of european biscuits and spreads. Great cappucino maker too! The Hotel Delle Nazioni felt like a home away from home. Stay there!!!! This hotel is a rare find.The best of the best!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelinggirlBerlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Spring vacation. The guys at the reception were very nice and funny. They gave us coupons for a free drink at the hotel bar on the arrival day. The room was normal size, with nice dark wooden floors, tv, and terrace windows. the bathroom was luxurious. Overall very clean and comfortable.
