The breakfast was normal, nothing too special, except for the days when there was amazing cake like rasperry cake. The location is perfect. I can't think of a better area to stay. Right nexto the Fontana di Trevi and just a short walk from the trendy Campo di Fiori. Be careful of weird people at night though (all over Rome). The Hotel delle Nazioni will let you have an amazing stay in bella Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Average holiday at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: makMumbai
Reviews.Content: My familyand I chose this hotel due to the location,which was the only good part about this hotel.It is next to Trevi fountain,10 minutes from spanish steps and the main shopping area in one direction,20-25 mins walk to colloseum towards the other direction along a street called via corso,10 mins to pantheon and 15 mins to piazza navona.It has a supermarket at the doorstep,bus station is next door from where you can take a bus to vatican city.Metro was supposed to be close by but we didnt use it ,instead walked to all the attractions except vatican and trestevere which we took taxi for 10 euros each way(metered taxi is a must). We had a suite which was 2 rooms but very small and bathroom was also miniature.Rooms were more 3 star than 4 ,Breakfast was not bad,Hotel had a safe location even at night,infact we found rome very safe,no issues at at all.Only place we found a bit dicey was the train station .Staff at hotel were quite curt and impolite never smiled at us,personally i felt this hotel is not worth the price.Attractions in Rome are close by and though i threw a coin in trevi fountain as i did 19 yrs back during my first visit,which may make me return in future i will not stay here.The hotel was too basic for me.Rome is a beautiful city with wonderful attractions and lovely shopping and excellent food(local and chinese) and we were blessed with excellent weather. Its a must visit city.CIAO

Reviews.Title: “Roman Adventure”
Reviews.Author: simon_allie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel in April. Its location is fantastic, being down a quiet side street but minutes away from the Trevi Fountain. The buffet breakfast met all requirements, only comment being there was not much hot food (scrambled eggs, bacon and boiled eggs) but there again it is a continental breakfact so plenty of breads, croissants, pastries, meat, cheese etc. Rooms a little on the small side but perfect for a city visit. Lovely and clean with crisp bed linen. Bathroom was again on the small side but had a bath to soak the weary limbs after a day walking round the sites! Toiletries were stocked up on a daily basis. Staff were pleasant and assisted with attempts at speaking italian. We were invited to a enjoy a free welcome cocktail and nibbles on our first night which was a nice touch. The bar seemed to close early (approx 10.30/11) but then again so did other non hotel establishments. All in all a very good base to explore this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...better than average updated room”
Reviews.Author: JBFChicago
Reviews.Content: Clearly, the recent review regarding a theft made it difficult to book with this hotel at first. Given the higher cost of other hotels and lack of availability in this particular area of town, I "took the chance" to book here in the end. This was my first time at this hotel. Thankfully, we experienced a better than average stay in a great location. $400 per night anywhere is a lot of money, but overall, I appreciated that the room was updated, of good size, walk in closet, double vanity sink bath, all clean lined and contemporary (wood floors, flat screen TV, nice newer gray fabric curtains/bed covers). Location is great..as mentioned. Isn't that what we are paying for? We used the train/metro which is conveniently located a few blocks away. Other than that, like most tourists, we were able to walk everywhere very easily. The hotel staff is simply adequate -- they seemed to be "just doing their job"..no more no less. I think the porter was the only one who actually smiled and made you feel welcome. I did not inquire about security in the hotel, I just made sure to use the room safe or lock items in my suitcase. Next time, I would still probably look for a better priced hotel, but overall, I had no major complaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience at the delle nazione”
Reviews.Author: bostonlawyer
Reviews.Content: we were three couples and checked in at about 2pm on tuesday,oct. 2nd. after checking in we took a walk for about an hour and a half and upon our return one of the couples found that someone had entered their locked room and took a small amount of american dollars and had forcibly opened his brief case. additionally the wife's clothing had been rifled and was strewn about the room. when he reported the theft to the four employees at the frontdesk no one seemed to care and he was told that he had to walk to the police station and report it there. no one bothered to look at the room or call the police or try to determine how entry was made. i have stayed here before and persuaded my friends to travel to rome and stay at the delle nazione..i will never stay there again. p.s. i suggested to the front desk staff that they should make a significant adjustment in my friend's bill it was met with a smirk and a "we definitely will not do that". a very bad and disappointing experience. p.c boston

Reviews.Title: “Excellen location but...................”
Reviews.Author: SMVC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hote for the last three years. I think the location is unsurpassed, it's a short stroll to the Trevi fountain. After the renovations the rooms were adequate rather than great and the service by some staff was excellent while by one in particular it was less than good. All in all I didn't enjoy the itas much as previously. But I would still stay there when in Rome, although I may look at trying a new hotel next time.
